Description: Fresh and fragrant this light white is packed with notes of white flowers, stone fruit and citrus. Well-balanced acidity and focused fruit on the palate make this ideal with seafood and fish.

title: Peique Seleccion Familiar Mencia 2014
Description: 100% Mencia from a 70-90 year old vineyard, planted at 450-580m ASL. Fermented in stainless steel over 35-52 days, then aged in 500L French oak barrels for 16 months prior to bottling.

title: Vistamar Corte de Campo Coastal Blend 2015
Description: A ripe and intense white with cooked apple, pie crust and caramel character. Full-bodied, layered and rich. A blend of chardonnay and viognier. Cool blend. Screw cap. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 29, 2017)

title: Bellingham Homestead Chardonnay 2016
Description: Aromatic, array of ripe kumquat, marmalade & blossom, subtle oak adds to balanced salt-sprinkled palate. Attractive, if not as lingering as 2015.  Score - 3.5 Stars (out of 5). (Platter's South African Wine Guide, 2018)

title: The Hilt Old Guard Chardonnay 2016
Description: The 2016 Chardonnay Old Guard is just as exceptional from bottle as it was from barrel. Tense and brilliant, with tons of pure class, the 2016 oozes with intensity in all of its dimensions. Crushed rocks, slate, lemon peel, mint and white pepper are all crisply delineated in a vivid, nuanced Chardonnay that hits all the right notes. In 2016, the Old Guard Chardonnay is a wine of translucent energy and vibrancy. Drinking window: 2018-2026. Score - 95. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Sept. 2018)

title: Argot Motifs Chardonnay 2015
Description: Features chalky, earthy notes that frame the core of apple and citrus flavors. The acidity lends vibrancy and drive, while the finish is clean and spicy, presenting a green apple edge. Drink now through 2020.  Score - 91. (James Laube, winespectator.com, June 15, 2017)
By:: Mixed Nuts, Llc Dba Argot Wines

title: Gini Contrada Salvarenza Vecchie Vigne Soave Classico 2016
Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, acacia and yellow stone fruit mingle with whiffs of hazelnut on this stunning white. Elegantly structured, the radiant palate has depth and complexity thanks to volcanic soils and 100-year-old vines, delivering apricot, ripe pear and tangy mineral notes evoking oyster shell before a white-almond finish. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2026. Ranked #17 in Wine Enthusiast's Top 100 Cellar Selections of 2020.  Score - 96. (Kerin O'Keefe, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2020)
By:: Gini Sandro E Claudio Soc. Agr. Sem

title: Trout Valley Pinot Gris 2017
Description: Nelson is situated in the northern region of New Zealand's South Island, just a touch farther north than Marlborough. Pinot Gris was first planted seriously in New Zealand in the early 1990s and has become the country's third-most-popular white variety, behind Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. This example is fresh and floral with brightly outlined green apple, citrus and ripe pear and a lovely peach finish. Try it with grilled salmon. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2017)

title: Pascal Jolivet Le Chêne Marchand Sancerre 2015
Description: Fresh, with good cut to the mix of gooseberry and white peach notes. A pithy jicama edge on the finish imparts tension. Drink now through 2018.  Score - 91. (James Molesworth, winespectator.com, April 30, 2017)

title: Te Mania Chardonnay 2016
Description: Whether you're grilling octopus, roasting chicken or ordering in Thai food, enjoy it with the nectarine and grapefruit character of this delicious Chardonnay. The light oak, ripe stone fruit and silky texture will turn you into an instant fan.

title: Mastroberardino Falanghina del Sannio 2016
Description: The Mastroberardino family is dedicated to making wine from ancient varieties that are indigenous to the region. Falanghina is thought by some to have been the basis of the legendary Falernian wine: the most prized wine of ancient Rome. This modern example is crisp and mineral with lovely chamomile, peach, lime and tropical fruit notes that'll pair smartly with seafood salads, or a pasta featuring anchovies and capers in a sauce of garlic, olive oil and fresh herbs. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2017)

title: Tenuta Massimiliana 2016
Description: This wine is fermented in baroque barrels, which results in a complex bouquet that balances exotic fruit with a touch of wood. Versatile and smooth, its warm character suits many different styles of food, making it a great choice for entertaining.

title: Watershed Senses Chardonnay 2016
Description: Small batch-fermented in French oak (18.5% new) on lees for 7 months with light battonage. The combination of high quality cool grown grapes and sensitive winemaking has produced this lovely chardonnay, the first release of a chardonnay in the Senses range. Delicacy teams with intensity (an oxymoron if ever there was one), grapefruit, white peach and nectarine the drivers, not the oak. Special Value. Drink By: 2029.  Score - 96. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2017)

title: Palatine Hills Prestige Blanc de Blancs
Description: Crafted using the traditional method, this classic sparkling wine from hand-selected grapes is elegant in style, rich in bouquet and delicate in flavour.

title: Stratus Evergreen Riesling 2016
Description: When Stratus opened, it was the world's first LEED-certified winemaking facility. No pumps are used to move the wine; liquid is moved through gravity or in tanks and barrels. The Evergreen Riesling is zesty and balanced, with touches of honey alongside the apple, peach, lime and mineral oil. A marvellous stone undertone carries through to the end of the long, spicy finish. Pair with Dijon-glazed ham or a spicy vegan potato curry. (Vintages panel, March 2018)

title: Qvinterra Riesling Dry 2017
Description: This opens with wonderful crushed stone flavours, intermixed with clear grapefruit and some fresh mint. Intense, round and creamy-textured.

title: Riesling Nierstein Kabinett 2014
Description: The nose here offers smoky black tea and zests of tangerine and lemon... A tactile impression of crushed stone, along with impingement of bittersweet candied lemon peel, contributes to the invigoration of a refreshingly and vibrantly sustained finish.

title: Nigl Grüner Veltliner Herzstuck vom Kirchenberg 2016
Description: 92 points James Suckling (Oct 2017) 'Quite a big, ripe wine with complex tropical fruit, mirabelle and green bean character. Enough acidity to balance the creaminess on the mid-palate and give a clean finish. Drink or hold.'

title: Deiss Engelgarten Le Jardin des Anges 2015
Description: 90 points Stephan Reinhardt (Wine Advocate Jun 2017) 'clear, deep, fresh and flinty on the nose. Ripe, lush and round on the palate, but with a finely grained and racy acidity, this is a well-balanced, elegant and lingeringly salty, riesling-dominated white wine that reveals a good tannin structure...'

title: Schloss Lieser Niederberg Helden GG 2016
Description: Fully fragrant with ample fruit, this sophisticated white has a complexity that cannot be underestimated. Concentrated fruit flavours, a juicy texture and an ultra-smooth character all make for a full-bodied wine that finishes long and luscious.

title: Toro Albala Electrico Bombilla Fino Rama
Description: 92 points (James Suckling July 2017) 'Pretty dry fino with almond, pear skin and apple character. Medium to full body. Dry and vivid. Flavorful finish. Nice combination of fruit and flor character.'

title: Sepp Moser Gruner Breiter Rain Erste Lage 2015
Description: Pure, complex and fresh on the promising nose, this is a medium to full-bodied, intense, austerely firm and tension-filled wine, with a long and piquant finish.

title: Marfil Blanc Classic 2017
Description: 'Bright straw colour with a light golden hue. Intense nose, aromatic with herbal notes like mint, lemon, lime and fresh apple. Good grip on the palate, fine extract and acidity with an herbal spiciness, crisp fruit, bold texture and good length.' (Andreas Larsson, 2018, Best Sommelier of the World, 2007).

title: Zacharias Assyrtiko 2018
Description: Assyrtiko is a classic Greek grape that provides great versatility, allowing dry or sweet styles. This one is dry with lots of melon and peach and a fine underlying minerality. It's fresh, crisp, and a good value. A fine option for seafood, this also has the texture to match with chicken. Split the difference and try it with grilled chicken-and-shrimp skewers. (Vintages panel, Aug. 2019)

title: Mercouri Kallisto 2017
Description: The Mercouri Estate in the western Peloponnese region of Greece creates Kallisto from native assyrtiko and robola grapes. Its bright aromas of freshly-grated lemon carry to flavours of fresh lemon, tangerine and pear. The finish is long and refreshing. Pair with lobster, chicken or a cheese and fruit platter.

title: Chao Rijo LX White 2016
Description: This fresh wine is a blend of traditional white grapes that flourish in the clay-limestone soils not far from Portugal's windswept and sometimes foggy Atlantic coast. It offers a bouquet of citrus and tropical fruits, with a unique minerality.

title: Malvasia Aromatica 2017
Description: A boutique winery located in Pontikiana village in Chiana, Crete. Straw yellow in colour, with nuances of lemon, peach, white flowers and pear. Added notes of apple and herbs lead to a medium-bodied and flavourful, long-lasting finish. A thirst-quenching wine ideal for grilled sea bass and rice with lemon-butter drizzle.

title: Malagouzia Organic White PGI 2017
Description: Made from 100% organic Malagouzia, this wine captures all of the grape's dynamic apricot, grapefruit and exotic fruit aromas. There's a touch of green bell pepper on the palate along with peach and hazelnut flavours. It's an excellent match for shellfish, lean white meat, pasta and Mediterranean cuisine.

title: Marcel Cabelier Chateau Chalon Vin Jaune 2009
Description: Full gold in colour, with a creamy, lemony scent in which bready notes are apparent. There's a typical Côtes du Jura acidic nerviness to this Vin Jaune, and an almost saline edge; you might also recall bread and seaweed. The palate finishes with unexpected warmth and richness, and some apricot fruit notes. Concentrated and complex.
By:: Les Grands Chais De France S.A

title: Bandit Pinot Grigio
Description: Light straw color with lifted aromas of fresh bread and grapefruit. Medium-bodied on the palate with mellow grapefruit and spice in the finish.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier Piesporter Goldtropfchen Riesling Kabinett 2016
Description: Rich, ripe passion fruit, berry and guava tones resound from nose to finish in this unabashedly tropical Riesling. While medium-sweet in style, it's refreshingly composed, marked by spine-tingling acidity. A sugary lace meanders long on the finish. It's approachable already, but structured enough to cellar through 2028. Score - 92. (Anna Lee Iijima, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2018)

title: 3 Monos Blanco de Itata 2015
Description: 54% Muscat of Alexandria / 46% Torontel 2015, sourced from the forgotten fringe of Itata Valley, dryfarmed head-trained vines, paying heed to the earliest origins of Chilean viticulture. Fresh, floral complexity, citrus zest and pith, bracing acidity, balanced and utterly different.

title: Collavini Turian Ribolla Gialla 2017
Description: A full and rich wine with lots of dense, dried fruit and spice. Love the intense flavors. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 25, 2018)

title: Campodora Albana Secco Romagna DOCG
Description: Grown in the Forli Hills of Italy's Emilia-Romagna region, the albana grape variety presents aromas of peach, apricots and citrus. It's dry, with light body and flavours of quince, peach and citrus. Balanced acidity and freshness make this an ideal pairing for seafood, risotto or white meats.

title: Château des Fines Roches Blanc 2016
Description: Floral aromas develop in the first two years of aging. Afterwards, they evolve towards fruit aromas like apricot with a touch of honey. Delicious with grilled fish or fish cooked in a white wine sauce. Also excellent with white meat such as veal. The gourmet diner will certainly appreciate tasting this wine with young goat cheese.

title: Metinella Ombra Toscana Bianco IGT
Description: Discover floral and fruity aromas and inviting notes of peach, citrus and chamomile leading to a delightfully long, gratifyingly dry finish. White meats, orzo, gnocchi - there are no wrong turns with this wine at the table.

title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot Terroirs Pouilly-Fuissé 2016
Description: While here too there are honeyed and exotic elements present on the slightly fresher aromas of citrus, acacia, passion fruit and essence of pear, they are both more subtle. There is evident underlying tension to the beautifully well-delineated flavors that aren't quite as dense but there is better complexity and notably better length on the more refined finale. Lovely stuff and worth your interest. Drink: 2021+. Outstanding.  Score - 91. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Oct. 15, 2018)

title: Château de la Grange Vieilles Vignes Côtes de Grand Lieu Sur Lie Muscadet 2017
Description: A nice value-priced wine that delivers solid varietal characteristics. Impressive pear, melon, apricot and peach tones, with lemon zest and a tantalizing hint of ginger over a refined mineral backbone. A great option for seafood dishes. (Vintages panel, March 2019)

title: Santa Rita Cavanza Sauvignon Blanc
Description: This white from the famed winery has its fruit sourced from carefully selected sites. Pale straw, it shows lovely floral aromas and flavours of passion fruit, lemon, fresh herbs and nuts. Medium-bodied and fresh, with a thirst-quenching finish, it is well suited for seafood salad or serves as a good base for white Sangria.

title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet, Sancerre Tradition 2017
Description: Expressive nose with floral and exotic fruity notes; lightly vegetal. A fresh attack on the palate, round and full-bodied; the finish is very fruity with an underlying vegetal edge.

title: Sattlerhof Sauvignon Blanc 2017
Description: 90 points (Wine Enthusiast Jan 2018) 'Subtle notes of ripe lemon and nettle mingle on the nose. The palate remains resolutely light and is bright with lemon freshness, with a dry finish that closes on a herbal tisane note.'

title: Lykos Pop Art White PGI Evia 2017
Description: From the vineyards of Evia in Central Greece comes Lykos Winery's athiri and malagousia blend. These native varieties combine in a white wine gem that exhibits floral and citrus aromas, flavours of citrus, herb and mineral and a refreshingly crisp finish. Enjoy with grilled octopus, roast chicken or as an aperitif.

title: Staete Landt Annabel Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: Wonderfully fruited and intensely aromatic, the bouquet shows green rockmelon, feijoa and lime peel characters, followed by a succulent palate that is concentrated and persistent. The wine offers excellent fruit purity backed by vibrant acidity, finishing long and delicious. At its best: now to 2022. Score - 93. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, Feb. 2019)

title: Jean Pabiot et Fils Domaine des Fines Caillottes Pouilly-Fumé 2018
Description: Classic aromas and flavors of grapefruit and gooseberry mark this vibrant version, with bright acidity running throughout. Spice notes emerge on the well-defined finish. Drink now through 2025.  Score - 89. (Aleksandar Zecevic, Wine Spectator, Nov. 15, 2019)

title: Château La Nerthe Châteauneuf-du-Pape Blanc 2018
Description: La Nerthe's whites are stunning in 2018. The 2018 Chateauneuf du Pape Blanc features scents of crushed stone, pineapple and tangerine, while being plush and ripe on the palate. It's full-bodied yet not fat or unbalanced, with vibrant, lime-like acids that prolong the silky-textured finish. Yum! Drink date: 2019-2026.  Score - 92. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2019)

title: Casa di Baal Bianco di Baal Campani 2017
Description: A beautifully fresh and easy to approach blend of Fiano, Moscato and Falanghina. Crisp and fruity, this is a really great example of what Italy's South has on offer. This is certified organic.
By:: Casa Di Baal Azienda Agricola Di Co

title: Casa di Baal Fiano di Baal 2015
Description: An organic wine made from Campania grapes, this Mediterranean-style white has stone fruit aromas, plus a lush body balanced by crisp acidity and lots of refreshing minerality. Try it with fish or shellfish dishes.
By:: Casa Di Baal Azienda Agricola Di Co

title: Patrick Javillier Les Tillets Meursault 2018
Description: The 2018 Meursault Les Tillets has a clean, well-defined bouquet with yellow plum, hazelnut and light waxy aromas developing in the glass. The palate is well balanced with orange rind and lemon zest on the entry. This is quite a phenolic Meursault, one that is well balanced with a complex finish befitting a vineyard like Les Tillets. Recommended. Drinking window: 2022-2030. Score - 91. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Boutari Oropedio 2017
Description: This wine has a deep pale-yellow gold hue, with aromas of wild white roses, citrus combined with a hint of grapefruit. On the palate, a very food-friendly wine, opulent with a rich mouthfeel, good acidity which gives it extra freshness, with a long and lingering finish.

title: Franco Roero Chardonnay 2017
Description: This Chardonnay shows Northern Italy's finesse with international varietals. Aromas of banana, yellow apple and sweet spices give character to a wine that's fruity but balanced with freshness. Pair it with seafood or risotto.

title: Filoco Reserva White 2016
Description: This wine style is white, tropical and balanced. Serve with chicken and turkey.

title: Filoco White 2017
Description: Tropical and balanced. Pairs well with chicken and turkey.

title: Ulupna Winery Single Vineyard Goulburn Valley Chardonnay 2017
Description: Pale lemon with strong green hints. Light aromas of fresh pineapple, melon, and grapefruit. Zingy but soft, with grapefruit, pineapple, and mandarins over a creamy mouthfeel; medium-bodied, with hints of almond and grapefruit on the finish.

title: Sancerre Blanc La Moussiere 2017
Description: Wine Advocate ''Alphonse Mellot junior, 19th generation of the flagship domaine in Sancerre, has 53 biodynamically farmed hectares of vines and offers a range of remarkably clear, elegant and polished single vineyard Sancerres. '' Wine Enthusiast ''This is one of the entry-level ranges from this top producer.''

title: Aromas4U Vinho Verde Alvarinho 2017
Description: Clean with citrine color, fruity scent, and harmonious taste. Long and persistent finish.

title: Mirus Loureiro DOC Verde
Description: 'Loureiro' means 'laurel' or 'bay,' and indeed, this white grape's delicate aroma is said to resemble laurel blossoms. Fresh and just slightly bubbly, it initially feels soft but finishes with a crisp acidity. Pair it with spicy barbecued dishes.

title: Mount Riley Sauvignon Blanc 2019
Description: The wine is fabulous fruited and lifted on the nose showing nectarine, grapefruit, feijoa and kaffir lime characters, leading to a vibrant palate that is intensely flavoured and lingering. The wine offers terrific fruit purity and lively mouthfeel. At its best: now to 2022. Score - 93. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, Sept. 2019)

title: Reif Reserve Gewürztraminer 2016
Description: A lovely, aromatic Niagara Gewurztraminer with attractive aromas of white florals, peach, Asian pear and lychee on the palate. Very Alsatian in style and elegance. Long finish. Pair with medium spices and curries. Drink: 2018-2023. Score - 91. (Natalie MacLean, nataliemaclean.com, Aug. 28, 2018)

title: Santa Ema Amplus Chardonnay 2018
Description: From Layda in the coastal Andes, and with an emphasis on luxury (3.19 grams of sugar), this Chardonnay presents a nose of pears, apples, herbs and oak. Refreshing with a full, creamy feel on the palate (thanks to the work with the lees), this is very much a designer white. Drinking window: 2020-2023. Score - 90. (Joaquín Hidalgo, vinous.com, March 2020)

title: Maison Louis Latour Montrachet Grand Cru 2018
Description: A magnificent white with such great depth of fruit and super intensity, showing flint, stone, nutmeg, thyme and light lemon rind. It's so full with deep, deep depth that brings you down through the wine. Lasts for minutes. Needs at least four or five years to show what its full potential. Drink after 2024. Score - 98. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 5, 2020)

title: Maison Louis Jadot Les Clos Chablis Grand Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Chablis Les Clos Grand Cru, aged for 15 months on the lees, has a generous nose of dried honey and pressed yellow flower scents, and just a touch of nutmeg in the background. The palate is well balanced with a peachy opening, slightly lower in acidity than its peers. The straightforward, quite honeyed finish will have wide appeal, even if it is lacking tension and race. Drinking window: 2021-2032. Score - 91. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Sept. 2020)

title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet Clos Saint-Philibert Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits
Patrao Diogo White 2017
Description: A signature white blend from a winery growing native grapes in the clay-limestone soils of southern Portugal, this maritime-fresh wine has floral and citrus scents, and a crisp mineral taste. Unoaked, it's a brilliant pairing with raw oysters.
By:: Chao De Areia - Vinhos E Event

title: Villa Wolf Gewürztraminer 2017
Description: With its amazing fragrance and its touch of sweetness, Gewürztraminers such as this can be the perfect standalone treat, especially when nicely chilled on a hot summer evening. As good as that sounds, this wine's honeyed peach and lychee flavours will also beautifully complement fried fish and spicy Thai salad. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2018)

title: Larry Charubino Pedestal Chardonnay 2017
Description: It's an accessible style, mostly pears and stone fruit flavours though with cuts of apple appearing as the palate progresses. No drapes, no shutters, no blinds; it's a window to the variety, open and clear.  Score - 91. (Campbell Mattinson, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2018)

title: Boyar Quantum Sauvignon Blanc 2017
Description: Domaine Boyar was founded in 1991 and is one of the most awarded wineries in Bulgaria. Look for crunchy green fruit and herbal notes in this 100' Sauvignon Blanc, and pair it with cabbage rolls.[Mundus Vini did not include a tasting note.] Score - Silver. (Mundus Vini, Spring Tasting 2018)

title: Feudo Maccari Olli Grillo 2019
Description: Aromas of sliced pears and lemons. Full body and candied-melon character, as well as a lemon undertone. Drink now. Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, July 1, 2020)

title: Snapper Rock Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: This classic Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc introduces a bouquet of nectarine, mango, melon and lime zest to a bright and juicy palate of young fruit. Pass it around with appetizers or serve it alongside chicken or seafood.

title: Maculan Pinot Grigio 2017
Description: The Breganze DOC is a small growing area within Veneto, with distinct geographical features that are unlike any other Veneto DOC. The resulting wines are similarly stylistically unique. From a producer of considerable reputation, this PG will suggest yellow plum, yellow cherry, apple and citrus peel, along with a hint of nuts. Always a satisfying sipper, it has the presence to be paired with grilled chicken or seafood.

title: Follow the Hand Italia Chardonnay 2016
Description: Full of apple, lemon and perhaps a little citrus. Perhaps a little uneven finish. Great present from a nice hostess at a Montalcino hotel. Sweet Memories.

title: Château-Fuissé Tête de Cuvée Pouilly-Fuissé 2017
Description: ***LATE ARRIVAL. PRODUCT NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE.***A blend from over 40 parcels across the estate, this wine is generous and rich. A light touch of wood enhances the fruitiness and fresh acidity. Structured at the end, the wine is ready to drink [now through 2024+]. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2019)

title: Joseph Drouhin Meursault 2018
Description: The 2018 Meursault Village comes from five separate climats and is fermented in 18-20% new oak. It has quite a steely bouquet, reserved at first and opening reluctantly with aeration to reveal strong gunflint aromas. The palate is well balanced with tempting pineapple and white peach notes drawing you in. Perhaps a little Chassagne-like in terms of weight, and quite persistent on the mint-tinged finish. Very fine, but I bet you drink it too early. Drinking window: 2022-2032. Score - 89-91. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Mauritson Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley 2017
Description: Our Sauvignon Blanc is both classic in its freshness and nuanced in its aromas and flavours. Lemon-lime zest, yellow peach, white magnolia blossom, and traces of wet stone waft from the glass. The entry is bright and focused. On the palate, complex flavours of candied grapefruit and honeydew rind give way to a finish that is clean and soft with balanced acidity. Enjoy this wine with light appetizers, salads, seafood dishes or on its own on a warm summer evening.

title: Dorna Velha Branco 2017
Description: This extra-fruity white is from the Douro wine region, tucked into the mountains of northeastern Portugal. That terroir contributes to the fresh citrus notes and balanced acidity. Serve it with a light salad and fish dishes.

title: Nautilus Chardonnay 2017
Description: A beautifully styled chardonnay, the inviting bouquet shows rockmelon, lemon peel, nougat, brioche and vanilla characters. The palate delivers excellent fruit concentration and weight, elegantly framed by fine texture and creamy mouthfeel, finishing persistent and engaging. Wonderfully balanced and harmonious with fabulous complexity. At its best: 2019 to 2024. Score - 94. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, May 2018)

title: Château de Nages Vieilles Vignes Blanc 2017
Description: The 2017 Costieres de Nimes Blanc Vieilles Vignes offers hints of apricot and lime and a plump, custardy-lees richness on the palate. This blend of 45% Grenache Blanc, 25% Roussanne, 20% Viognier and 10% Clairette is medium to full-bodied, with plenty of concentration and length. It's hard to believe such a terrific white wine is available for under $20. Drink date: 2018-2020. Score - 92. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2018)

title: Casa Monte Pío Albariño 2016
Description: 100% Albariño. A zesty, fresh and clean medium-bodied wine with lustrous notes of quince, pear and mandarin.  Score - 89. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Domaine Laroche Vieilles Vignes Les Vaillons Chablis 1er Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Chablis Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes 1er Cru is laced with lemon confit, citrus peel, almond, dried flowers and chamomile. Aromatic and light on its feet, the 2018 offers lovely near and medium-term appeal. This is such an attractive 1er Cru. Drinking window: 2020-2028. Score - 91. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Henri Ehrhart Réserve Particulière Pinot Gris 2017
Description: Elegant and balanced with layers of yellow apple, peach, pear and a touch of quince. A good choice for curried shrimp. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2018)[The Concours Général Paris did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Concours Général Paris, 2018)

title: Dereszla Dorombor Dry 2015
Description: This fresh and delicate wine cuvee is made of of 55% Furmint, 30% Yellow Muscat and 15% Hárslevel grape varieties. The fruitiness is dominating in the nose, while the minerality along with the lively acidity typical for this vintage plays on the palate. A hint of residual sugar makes this wine smooth and appetizing. We recommend it for summer night discussions and relaxation, for white meats and fruit salads. Best served chilled.

title: Gehringer Brothers Private Reserve Pinot Gris 2017
Description: This wine offers notes of white peach, grapefruit, citrus and a delectable touch of honey. Dry and quite fresh, this zippy, intriguing wine is a fine palate-refresher, or match it to grilled calamari.[The Indy International Wine Competition did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Indy International Wine Competition, 2018)

title: Hogue Gewürztraminer 2017
Description: Made in stainless steel to maximize aromatic freshness, this is exuberantly floral with waves of rose petal along with lychee, lemon zest, honey and peach, with a dusting of sweet-and-savoury spices on the nicely balanced finish. A great value, it'll be fantastic with pulled-pork sandwiches.  (Vintages panel, Sept. 2018)

title: Kettmeir Pinot Grigio 2017
Description: This PG was given five months on the lees to add extra dimension, which really shows in the texture. The nose is lightly floral and grassy with subtle lemon pith, apple and yellow plum, and the palate, while silkily elegant, has a bit more oomph than the delicate aromas might suggest. It all culminates in a tart, tangy finish that calls out for food. Sip with grilled chicken pasta in olive oil and a squeeze of lemon. (Vintages panel, April 2019)

title: St. Hubertus Pinot Blanc 2016
Description: Gold Medal winner at the 2018 National Wine Awards of Canada.As [this] wine shows, this variety delivers lots of fruit, with aromas and flavours of apples. The finish is crisp.  Score - 90. (John Schreiner, johnschreiner.blogspot.com, March 9, 2017)

title: Wieninger Wiener Gruner Kaasgraben 2016
Description: A vineyard high on the Nussberg hill gives this hugely concentrated wine perfumed flavours of ripe plums to go with its touch of pink grapefruit. Well structured and outstanding.

title: La Croix Montjoie L'Impatiente Vézelay 2016
Description: From 25 year old vines grown on clay/limestone soil, 9 months' vinification, 100% in stainless steel tanks. Pale gold, fresh and zesty nose of citrus and white flowers, very refreshing with a zippy character throughout. Best as an apéritif or with simple dishes, works very well with seafood or mixed charcuterie and goat cheeses, age for 3 years max to best capture its youthful and impatient character.

title: Monte Velho White 2017
Description: This balanced Portuguese white is a shining example of wines from the hot, dry south-central and southern regions of Alentejo. Its growing conditions create full-bodied flavours and a rich, smooth finish. The crisp citrus notes complement grilled fish and seafood.

title: McMichael Collection Tom Thomson Barrel-Aged Chardonnay 2017
Description: Featuring label artwork from the McMichael Collection and bottled exclusively for Vintages just in time for Canada Day 2019, this creamy, mouthfilling barrel-aged Chardonnay is a work of art unto itself, with rich notions of butter, vanilla and caramel underscored by crisp apple, citrus and pear. A great choice for pork chops, preferably cooked over a wood fire. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2018)

title: Collavini T Friulano 2017
Description: Quite a developed dry white with pronounced lemon-curd character on the nose. Serious depth and some structure, which are well balanced by lemony freshness at the finish. With more complexity this would rate higher. Drink now. Score - 90. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 25, 2018)

title: Domaine Ponsot Corton Charlemagne Grand Cru 2017
Description: As good a rendition of this cuvée as I can remember tasting, the 2017 Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru is superb, unfurling in the glass with aromas of beeswax, white flowers, crisp yellow orchard fruit and wet stones, with nuances of nutmeg and fresh apricot emerging as it sits in the glass. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, satiny and incisive, with a concentrated core, succulent acids and a wonderful sense of energy and tension that balances its comparatively broad shoulders. It's produced from two parcels in Aloxe-Corton, one warmer and the other cooler. Score - 94-96. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 4, 2019)

title: Domaine Ponsot Cuvée de la Mesange Saint-Romain 2017
Bott Geyl Riesling GC Schoenenbourg 2014
Description: Crisp green apples on the nose, with grapefruit rind savouriness. Honey, marmalade and spice on the palate with an intense finish. An organic and biodynamic producer.

title: Aveleda Loureiro 2017
Description: The 2017 Loureiro Colheita Selecionada comes in with eight grams of sugar and 11.5% alcohol and no fizz. Sourced from a mixture of subregions, this is another stunning value from Aveleda this issue. No one cries for Goliath, but it is easy to forget how good the Aveleda wines can be for such modest money. The sugar is completely balanced by the acidity here. There's a hint of off-dry but no more than that. It shows good concentration, especially for this level, a fine, tense finish, and a tinge of lime on that finish. I personally preferred this to the regular Estate Branco this issue, but they are close and reasonable minds might differ. Typically, what Aveleda makes also ages very well. They won't necessarily blossom and improve dramatically, but I won't be surprised if this is still fine and still at peak five years from now. It will be great this summer too. Drink Date: 2018-2024.  Score - 90. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, June 29, 2018)

title: Domaine Jean-Louis Chave Hermitage Blanc 2017
Description: In the end, I'm unable to definitely say that the 2017 Hermitage Blanc is better than the stupendous 2016. Of course, I sampled it just three days after it was bottled, so I've appended the + to my rating, as there's a possibility the wine may have been affected by that process. It's gently toasty but dominated at this stage by forward melon and pineapple fruit. Full-bodied and incredibly rich yet balanced, it unfolds in waves of flavor and texture, lingering for what seems like minutes on the finish. Hit it soon to enjoy its youthful opulence, or put it aside for 10-12 years. Drink date: 2020-2040. Score - 98+. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, Dec. 19, 2019)

title: Tenuta Roveglia Vigne di Catullo Lugana Riserva 2014
Description: 100% Trebbiano di Lugana. Complex and multi-layered on the nose with honey, caramel, ginger, peaches and white flowers. Rich and round, sustained by crisp freshness with dry herbs and fennel seed notes. A great wine!  Score - 96. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2018)

title: Esk Valley Chardonnay 2017
Description: A neat chardonnay with compact texture and some richer flavors. Aromas of peaches and almond nougat lead to a palate that tastes of buttered popcorn, then turns warm and takes on a hazelnut flavor through the finish. Drink now. Score - 90. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 8, 2018)

title: Pierpaolo Pecorari Pinot Grigio Friuli 2018
Description: Aromas of golden apple, pineapple, alps hay, cherry blossom. Elegant & fresh on the palate, full body, with bright acidity. Fruity & stony minerality. Serve with fish dishes, crustaceans and seafood, pasta dishes, white meat.

title: Albert Bichot Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Clos Chablis Grand Cru 2018
Description: Beautiful subtlety on this wine's nose recalls smoky lemon, citrus pith and molten candlewax. The palate also holds these notions, bolstering that lemony waxiness with thick, layered chalkiness and pithy, mouthwatering freshness. This is concentated and bold, offering energy and drive, with a contradictory heat emanating from a cool core. A compelling wine, it needs to calm down a little. Drink date: 2025-2040. Score - 97. (Anne Krebiehl, MW, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2020)

title: Domaine Bouchard Père & Fils Genevrières Meursault 1er Cru 2016
Description: Residual SO2 is sufficient to dominate the nose today. Marvelously energetic and intensely mineral-driven flavors also possess excellent cut that characterizes the bitter lemon and saline-inflected finish that delivers seriously fine length. This chiseled effort is almost Chablis-like and will require at least a few years of bottle age first. Sweet spot, Outstanding. Drink 2024+. Score - 93. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, June 15, 2015)

title: Peter Zemmer Giatl Riserva Pinot Grigio 2016
Description: The oak-aged 2016 Alto Adige Pinot Grigio Riserva Giatl is a medium to full-bodied white wine with nuances of summer peach, Golden Delicious apple and lemon mousse. That chorus of yellow fruit flavors is really very beautiful. The wine wraps thickly over the palate with a rich texture and creamy disposition followed by breezy acidity. Some 11,000 bottles were produced. Drink Date: 2018-2024. Score - 92+. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

title: De Wetshof Bataleur Chardonnay 2016
Description: Gravel soils rich in limestone and clay produce a Chardonnay of supreme elegance and florality. Pear drop and citrus elements on the nose lead to controlled richness on the palate whose classy, harmonious finish assures a great future. Drinking Window: 2019-2026. Score - 95. (Steven Spurrier, decanter.com, Undated)

title: Doudet Naudin Vin de France Chardonnay 2017
Description: Aromatic, fine, and well-balanced wine with its light golden colour with some green highlights. Nuances and taste of linden-tree, mango, peach and some citrus. In the mouth the wine is very charming, thanks to its freshness and its fruity aromas.

title: Anthosmias White
Description: An excellent medium sweet rose wine. Light rose in colour, with crisp and refreshing intense flower, fruit, and honey flavours. A good firm structure with a long luxurious finish.
By:: G. Tsimpidis And Co. Monemvasia Win

title: Estate Argyros Vinsanto 4 Year 2011
Description: The wine has a copper-amber colour and on the nose strong and complex aromas of chocolate, honey, roasted coffee grains, dried fruits and dried nuts. On the palate the wine is full bodied, buttery, well structured & balanced, with sweetness and acidity in harmony, it has a fine and long finish.

title: Charles Heintz Chardonnay 2017
Description: White flowers reach out of the glass like jasmine and the palate is a smooth yet rich expression of tropical and mineral flavours. The weight and texture of this wine is gracefully balanced by the acidity and what feels like a never-ending finish.

title: Kir Yianni Assyrtiko 2018
Description: Made with 100% Assyrtiko, this wine is intense, with refreshing acidity and firm structure. Serve with fish fillet (roasted or poached), fried cod, oven-roasted stuffed squid, pasta in white sauce, white cheeses.

title: Domaine Guenault Touraine Sauvignon Blanc AOC 2018
Description: This Loire white displays the classic properties of the grape and has a golden colour with a green sheen. It has an aromatic nose with fruity characters, zesty citrus fruits, cut grass, crisp and fresh white buds aromas. In the mouth, flavours of gooseberry and herbs persist.

title: Chateau Miqueu Haut Medoc AOC 2015
Description: Fairly deep and intense colour with nice bright hints. The nose reveals delightful black fruits aromas, slightly toasted. The attack is elegant and characterized by lightly grilled notes. Fleshy and ripe tannins mid-palate. Long and silky finish with blackberry and blackcurrant notes.

title: The Lady Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie 2018
Description: Cosmopolitan globe-trotter, an international vision on the world. I do not follow trends, I anticipate them. I have an unique style and an unmistakable identity, I distinguish myself for unconventional details.

title: Nederburg Manor House Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: Avoiding greenness is very much the aim of this unwooded, passion fruity Sauvignon Blanc from Darling. Zesty and fresh with a hint of sea breeze, it's a pleasure to drink. Drink Date: 2019-2021. Score - 90. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2018)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Charmes Meursault 1er Cru 2018
Description: Very opulent white with pure apple, mango and lemon-pie character. Some toffee undertones. Full-bodied with depth and intensity on the palate, creamy texture and a frame of acidity. Lots of flavor with a nice, wood and vanilla complement to the fruit at the end. Drink or hold. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 24, 2020)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Monopole Clos de la Chapelle Chassagne-Montrachet Morgeot 1er Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru Morgeot Clos de la Chapelle (Domaine du Duc de Magenta) is showing well, opening in the glass with notes of crisp green orchard fruit, dried white flowers, fresh pastry and blanched almonds. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, structured and tangy, with lively acids and good dry extract. Score - 92-94 . (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Les Folatières Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru 2018
Description: Pungent aromas of strong petrol and wood toast largely bury the otherwise softly exotic aromas of passion fruit and white peach. There is a lovely sense of vibrancy to the highly seductive if not especially dense middle weight flavors that exude a subtle minerality on the lingering finish that tightens up rapidly as it sits on the palate. This is still coming together but it appears as though it will blossom in time. Drink: 2028+. Sweet spot. Outstanding. Score - 91-93. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, June 10, 2020)

title: Falchini Vigna a Solatio Vernaccia di San Gimignano 2017
Description: Tuscany's most famous white wine style is made from the Vernaccia grape grown around the ancient village of San Gimignano. This stunning example shows aromas of green apple and citrus, with a sleek, mineral-laced palate and a touch of bitter nuttiness on the finish. Ideal for grilled seafood or pulled pork. (Vintages panel, July 2018)

title: Dagueneau Pouilly Fume Clos Chaudoux 2017
Description: Noble, fresh and deeply aromatic on the clear nose, with flinty aromas of star fruit, yeast, herbs and bacon. This is a firmly structured, dense, rich, full-bodied and powerful late harvest sauvignon blanc. Lots of complexity to this one.

title: Domaine du Crêt de Bine Cuvée de Florence 2018
Description: This is 100% chardonnay grown in the Southern region of Beaujolais. It's bright and crisp with notes of apple and stone fruit. Two thirds were aged in used oak, so expect a touch of spice. Excellent balance leads to a great finish. Certified Organic & Biodynamic.
By:: Scea Subrin Et Associes - Domaine D

title: Vino Lauria Solerte Bianco 2018
Description: This is made with 100% Moscato grapes, known as Zibibbo in Sicily. It's a dry wine, offering up lots of pink grapefruit, honeysuckle, and floral notes, backed by mouthwatering cripness and minerality. Certified Organic.

title: Leeuwin Art Series Chardonnay 2017
Description: This achieves another step up the quality ladder for Leeuwin Estate, seemingly impossible. There's been no change in the vinification, nor in the vineyard. The change is an increase in the intensity of the flavours, and hence their length and aftertaste. It's an extraordinary wine, among the greatest of Burgundy (and elsewhere in the world). Whatever you expect from its future development will be delivered. Drink by: 2032. Special Value. Rated as Best Chardonnay of the Year in the 2021 Halliday Wine Companion.  Score - 99. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2020)

title: Zanatta Vermentino di Sardegna 2018
Description: This Cannonau Riserva stands out for its elegance. On the palate it is not too bold, nonetheless intense, structured, long lasting, and balanced. It has a garnet-red colour, a bouquet of ripe fruits together with notes of toasted oak and vanilla. A mix of spices and vanilla linger on the long finish.

title: Domaine de Montille Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru 2017
Description: The purity of yellow citrus fruit here is stunning and there's a distinctive, chalky wedge to the nose, too. The palate has a very elegant, sleek and contained feel with a strong line of acidity and creamy, lees-derived weight. This has the DNA of power and the length is exceptional. Regal. Try in 2022. Score - 95-96. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 12, 2019)

title: Domaine William Fèvre Bougros Chablis Grand Cru 2017
Description: A cool and ripe nose features notes of pear and apple that possess background nuances of iodine and seashell. There is excellent mid-palate concentration to the big, very rich and concentrated flavors that display a very round and suave mouth feel, all wrapped in a powerful, dry and slightly rustic finale. This muscular and robust effort delivers sneaky good length and while it needs to develop more depth, it has the potential aging curve to do so. Drink 2029+. Score - 93. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Oct. 10, 2019)

title: Bouchard Père & Fils Chevalier-Montrachet Grand Cru
Joseph Drouhin Les Folatières Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru
Esk Valley Verdelho 2018
Description: This Verdelho is sourced from our Omahu Gravels Vineyard located in the Gimblett Gravels and our organic Joseph Soler Vineyard on the outskirts of Flaxmere. The Omahu vines were planted in 1998 and hold the distinction of being the first Verdelho vines planted in New Zealand's recent viticultural history. The fruit reflects the stony soils in which they are grown and provides the wine with a mineral infused note and flavours of mandarin and passionfruit. These vines are intensively managed and cropped at low yields to fully capture the potential of the sites.

title: D.G. White 2018
Description: Yellow citrus colour and brilliant aspect. Intense aroma with notes of tropical fruits. In the mouth it is balanced, very fresh and has good structure.

title: EA White 2018
Description: Citurs colour with a greenish hue. Intense aroma reminiscent of tropical fruit, fresh grass, with light floral notes. Well balanced in the palate showing good acidity.

title: Schiopetto Pinot Grigio des Rosis 2018
Description: This is a very minerally pinot grigio with undertones of sliced apples, pears and slate. Full-bodied, layered and beautiful.

title: Schiopetto Ribolla Gialla des Rosis 2018
Description: This is fantastic. There's a linear edge underlying the exotic mangoes and white peaches. Full-bodied, yet always energetic and tangy.

title: Omrah Chardonnay 2017
Description: Complex palate of white peach, honeyed brioche, lemon cream, nougat, cashews, quite a savoury cool climate palate. Great fresh acidity balanced with lees. Good length and finishes savoury but clean.

title: Balbás Verdejo 2018
Description: This is layered with cooked apples, pears and bitter lemon. Full body, yet crisp acidity and depth with a vivid finish. Dense and flavorful yet fresh. Dried fruit. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 26, 2019)

title: Inurrieta Orchidea 2018
Description: A beautiful greenish yellow colour, the nose is intense, with the wood appreciating in its proper measure, appearing a tempting mix of tropical fruit and apple aromas, accompanied by delicate notes of honey and vanilla. On the palate, the wine is fat and voluptuous and at all times wrapped in a refreshing acidity that makes it flow in the mouth without effort. Always present a delicate fruit flavour with subtle oak memories.

title: Giesen The August Sauvignon Blanc 2014
Description: Rich ripe tropical and herbal notes along with steely, wet pebble aromas and purity. Featuring passionfruit and lime leaves, this Sauvignon Blanc is multi-dimensional and layered with toasty almonds, fresh brioche and incredible flinty notes. Well-integrated oak provides complexity and elegance.

title: Winzerkeller Andau Gruner Veltliner 2018
Description: Our Gruner Veltliner shows white gold with green reflections in the glass. On the nose it smells of fresh stone fruit and shows a fine spice. On the palate, the Veltliner is fruity-elegant with stone fruit notes paired with a fine acidity. Our Gruner Veltliner is dry and offers incredible drinking fun.

title: Soligo Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie 2018
Description: Bright straw yellow in colour with greenish reflections. On the nose, notes of hawthorn, broom and daisy, followed by pear, apple and plum . On the palate, delicate, fresh and well-balanced. Serve with seafood salads, fish-based first courses and soups. Pairings with boiled fish and soufflés are also interesting.

title: Peju Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: Beautiful, fresh and crisp, expect lots of stone fruits, minerality, and a touch of tropical citrus. It's mid weight, with a good finish.

title: Cave de Turckheim Brand Riesling 2017
Description: Earth and dried lime-peel notes cling to lemon aromas on the nose of this wine. The palate adds stony depth and hints of passion fruit to the concentrated, vivid body. It finishes dry and long, with bright citrus, ripe pineapple and stony depth. Score - 94. (Anne Krebiehl, MW, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 1, 2019)

title: Vidal Reserve Pinot Gris 2018
Description: Enticing aromas of baked apple, spice and pear combine with floral notes and lead into a dry and softly textured palate showing lovely fruit purity. Low yielding vines with good fruit exposure have resulted in good flavour intensity and ripeness. Small parcels of Gewürztraminer (4%) and Albarino (1%) were blended into the wine adding further complexity and interest.

title: Christina The Heritage Collection Chardonnay 2017
Description: All-new French oak for 2017, perfectly matched to the citrus intensity, lemon, tangerine, coating the fruit with buttered toast savouriness. Sleekly curvaceous, characterful, lots to admire. From a single block.  Score - 93. (Platter's South African Wine Guide, 2019)

title: Pencarrow Sauvignon Blanc 2017
Description: It is intensely aromatic on the nose showing passionfruit, feijoa, musk and lemon zest characters. The palate is impressively fruited and vibrant, delivering pristine fruit flavours backed by fine texture and mouth-watering acidity. An instantly appealing sauvignon filled with delectable flavours. At its best: now to 2020. Score - 93. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, June 2018)

title: Jorche Bianco 2015
Description: A crisp and refreshing white, with herbal tones over lemon zest, melon, and pear fruit flavours.

title: Glenelly Glass Collection Unoaked Chardonnay 2019
Description: The Glenelly Glass Collection Unoaked Chardonnay has complex aromas of citrus peel, pear drop, stem ginger and honey suckle.  On the palate, there is a beautiful round comforting texture with wonderful length and intense fruit complexity and balance.  When Chardonnay is as pure, ripe and generous as it is here, there is definitely no need to add oak!

title: Graf Neipperg Riesling Trocken Dry 2018
Description: Fine riesling fragrance, with distinct fruit flavours (quince and apple). Round, juicy wine with powerful finish.

title: Babich Family Estates Organic Albarino 2018
Description: Sweetly perfumed and floral aromas (apple blossom) with lime and white stone fruits. Big, juicy entry with sweet citrus fruits and some tart apple notes. Nicely textured and lush mid-palate, moving to a spicy and lingering, mineral finish. Pair with fish and seafood of all kinds. Spicy dishes also can work well.

title: Montefalco Grechetto DOC 2017
Description: Entirely made from Grechetto grape, this wine has a straw yellow colour thanks to the short time that the grape skin is left in the must. Its scent is reminiscent of sambuco flowers, elderflower, broom, peach and mango. It also has a olfactory note of aromatic herbs, namely thyme and sage. It has a pleasant dry, fresh taste and is full in flavour.

title: Domaine Billaud-Simon Les Preuses Chablis Grand Cru 2015
Description: This is noticeably more reserved with its pure nose of green fruit, mineral reduction and sea shore scents. The palate impression of the slightly more voluminous and decidedly succulent flavors that are also somewhat less refined than usual while offering lovely depth and length on the well-balanced finish where a hint of wood can be found. This notably pretty effort should benefit from a few years of cellar time to develop more depth. Drink 2021+. Score - 92. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, Oct. 11, 2017)

title: Lieutenant de Sigalas Rabaud 2009
Description: This second wine of Château Sigalas Rabaud will be characterful, with classic exotic tones, splashes of honeycomb, fresh spice and lifted aromatics. Expect a rich, layered wine that will have a long, gorgeously satisfying finish.

title: Altenberg de Wolxheim Riesling 2013
Description: Aromas of baked apple and dried mandarin peel unite into a most alluring, almost lifted nose. The palate remains wonderfully dry, highlighting the beautifully pure lemon at its core and a textured, chalky freshness. This is concentrated, toned and totally delicious. The finish is of purest lemon. Drink now through 2028. Score - 94. (Anne Krebiehl, MW, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 1, 2018)

title: Survivor Chenin Blanc 2019
Description: Survivor Chenin Blanc is made from hand harvested grapes solely from the warm Swartland region of South Africa. The wine is put in mature French oak barrels for just a short period to time, to round out the wine and add more complexity. This medium bodied wine shows hints of citrus, apricot, peach and butter and has a fresh and crisp finish. Survivor Chenin Blanc matches quite well with fish, pastas with cream or olive oil sauces, chicken and lighter salads. Serve chilled and enjoy!

title: F.X.Pichler Loibner Grüner Veltliner Federspiel 2017
Description: The 2017 Loibner Grüner Veltliner Federspiel is clear and very aromatic on the spicy nose. Sourced on gravelly and sandy soils between the federal road and the Danube River and vinified in stainless steel, this is an easy-drinking, fruity Veltliner.

title: F.X. Pichler Ried Steinertal Grüner Veltliner Smaragd 2017
Description: 91 points Wine Advocate 'From a steep and terraced vineyard with decomposed gneiss soils, the 2017 Ried Steinertal Grüner Veltliner Smaragd is very clear and intense on the fruit-driven, slightly tropical but also flinty-scented nose. Powerful, intense and lush on the palate, this is a full-bodied but fine and elegant, well-structured and minerally Veltliner with good tannin grip and a persistent finish.'

title: F.X. Pichler Ried Burgstall Riesling Federspiel 2017
Description: 93 points Wine Advocate 'The 2017 Ried Burgstall Riesling Federspiel is from a windy plateau with sandy gneiss soils. Crunchy and mineral on the nose! The highly aromatic nose is super clear and fresh, and the palate is crisp and crunchy with highly stimulating fruit, mineral freshness and grip. Gorgeous!'

title: F.X. Pichler Dürnsteiner Riesling Smaragd 2017
Description: 92 points Wine Advocate 'The 2017 Dürnsteiner Riesling Smaragd (formerly Oberhauser) is from the first picking in the terraces as well as from the Trum and Oberhauser (today Klostersatz). Fermented in stainless steel and bottled in April, the wine shows a fine and discreet, herbal/floral-scented apricot nose that leads to a racy-piquant, light and crispy palate with enormous purity and freshness. Grown on gravelly soils in the plains, this is a stunning, vital and crunchy Smaragd with a long, intense and purely mineral finish that is full of tension.'

title: F.X.Pichler Klost Loibenberg Grüner Veltliner Smaragd 2017
Description: 93 points Wine Advocate '...from granite and gneiss soils on the south-facing terraces of the prestigious cru. Pure, fine and flinty on the elegant and even coolish, yellow-fruit nose, this is a full-bodied, rich and generous but elegant Veltliner with piquant acidity and salinity from the gneiss soils. Powerful and rich but immersive in its elegance, finesse, freshness and minerality.'

title: Tinhof Weissburgunder 2017
Description: Pinot Blanc gives this wine a classic, yet soft and creamy character. There is just a touch of smokiness adding interest to the ripe red-apple flavours. It's a luscious wine that's ready to drink now.

title: Tinhof Leithaberg Neuberger 2017
Description: 92 points Wine Enthusiast 'Earth, menthol, ripe quince and fresh red apple with an edge of orange peel create an intriguing and rich nose. The palate continues in this rich vein, presenting an almost oily texture against which fresh lemon plays and tingles. The rich fruit flavors come together, and the finish has a pleasant nuttiness.'

title: F.X.Pichler Ried Klostersatz Grüner Veltliner Federspiel 2017
Description: 88 points Wine Advocate 'From the alluvial and gravelly soils in the vineyards around the domaine, the 2017 Ried Klostersatz Grüner Veltliner Federspiel is fresh and spicy on the clear and refreshing nose with its white fruit aromas. Piquant and fresh on the palate, this is a medium-bodied, quite powerful but racy Veltliner with good grip and tension. The finish is very fruity but also piquant and even a bit salty.'

title: Loveblock Pinot Gris 2018
Description: Delicate aromas of rock-melon, lime and green tea yield to additional notes of green pear and ripe melon. The flavours follow suit, supported by a rich, underlying texture and rocky minerality.

title: Tikves Cuvee Cyril 2018
Description: This wine has an an appealing combination of green apple with refreshing mineral notes over a creamy palate and with a zesty peppery finish.

title: Villa Sparina Gavi di Gavi 2018
Description: Straw-yellow in colour with the fragrance of flowers, fruit and hints of peach. Full and rich taste, soft and harmonical with tones of noble aromas, resulting from the complete ripening of the grapes, which intensify the character.

title: Loveblock Gewürztraminer 2018
Description: Pale gold with green inflections, this wine shows a classic rosewater perfume, Turkish delight and a hint of orange zest. Notes of guava, ripe mandarin and blood orange enter on the palate, with a round texture and beautiful, lingering freshness.

title: Loveblock Sauvignon Gris 2014
Description: Delicate aromas of peach and juicy citrus notes are underscored with passionfruit and a hint of oak in this incredible back vintage of this variety that is a genetic offshoot of Sauvignon Blanc. Here, find more pitted fruit and a slightly savoury, saline note that lingers through the finish. A truly remarkable look into aged New Zealand white wine.

title: Tikves Smederevka Belo 2018
Description: A pale lemon wine delivering tropical and stone fruit aromas underpinned by a streak of zesty citrus. Beautifully balanced on the palate with crisp and refreshing fruit flavours through to a clean, vibrant finish.

title: Silvio Carta Vermentino di Gallura DOCG Superiore Serenata 2018
Description: Originally from the Iberian Peninsula, Vermentino reached Sardinia after a long journey through the south of France and Liguria. This is a superiore, which means it's a bit more full bodied than the regular Vermentino. Expect lots of citrus notes.

title: Herdade Sanat Ana Reserva White 2017
Description: Citric colour. Reveals very fine aromas with tropical notes and a mineral hint. Fine and elegant acidity with great freshness and a long aftertaste.

title: Kalogeri Malagouzia 2018
Description: Golden in colour, aroma reminiscent of exotic fruit, balanced and round palate with floral aftertaste. Accompanies seafood, oven baked fish, poultry. Also to be enjoyed with fruit.

title: Aphros Aether White Blend 2013
Description: 89 points Wine Enthusiast 'A delicious tight, crisp and mineral wine that has intense acidity as well as a nervy citrus character. Shots of green cut through the wine give freshness as well as a bright, light aftertaste.'

title: Villa Maria Res Barrique Chardonnay 2017
Description: Styled to capture the regional essence of Gisborne, this wine offers a complex medley of aromas with hints of tropical fruits, fig and smoky grilled nut characters. The palate is seamlessly textured with a creamy mid-palate, leading to a finish extended by fine acidity. This concentrated and powerful wine retains a harmonious balance in delivery that will appeal for enjoyment upon release, but will ultimately benefit from maturation, continuing to develop intriguing complexity over the next 8-10 years.

title: Villa Maria Single Vineyard Pinot Gris 2018
Description: The 2018 Single Vineyard Pinot Gris is solely sourced from our iconic Seddon vineyard, on the southern bank of the Awatere River. This Pinot Gris is a rich, textural, opulent wine with a creamy palate from spending extended time ageing on yeast lees. Aromas of fresh honeycomb intermingle with juicy summer peaches, the fleshy palate is framed by a soft but balanced acidity with an exotic, unctuous texture.

title: Mirus DOC Verde
Description: Delicate floral notes, with lemon and lime, melon and peach aromas and flavours. Palate is dry, crisp and fresh with a clean finish. Low in alcohol and quite refreshing.

title: Spy Valley Easy Tiger Sauvignon Blanc 2019
Description: Crisp and bright with aromas and flavours of tropical fruit and grapefruit. Long, soft finish.

title: Domaine Potinet Ampeau Bourgogne Blanc 2013
Description: Young vines in Monthelie and Meursault are treated with the same care as the village and 1er cru wines, with minimal oak influence and freshness the key. Waves of white fruits, citrus, melon, creme and stony mineral touches have presence and effusiveness rarely seen in a humble Bourgogne Blanc. This wine is delicious, has a little bottle age and is a tremendous example of a producer clearly in touch with his vines. Superb!
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Chateau Caillou Sauternes Grand Cru 2015
Description: 93 points James Suckling 'Very attractive ripe-mango and papaya character and great balance between concentrated fruit, sweetness, oak and acidity make this a delicious Sauternes to drink right now.'

title: Maison Coria Chassagne Montrachet 1er cru 'les vergers' 2017
Description: This wine boasts a profound minerality (flint). Age brings in notes of honey or ripe pear. Rounded and often opulent, its attack is instantaneous. On the palate, fleshiness is matched by mellowness, and both are equally persistent. Opulence and power make it an ideal partner for delicate fine white meats such as poultry or veal in sauce.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Weinhauss Bettina Shumann Grauburgunder Dry 2018 Pinot Gris
Description: Fresh fruity fragrance of williams pear, a light smokey scent make this Pinot Gris the prefect choice for all occasions.

title: Touraize Chardonnay Arces 2017
Description: This is 100% Chardonnay from the Arbois PDO. The wine spends 18 months on lees, is unfiltered, and undergoes spontaneous fermentation so expect a fuller, more natural tasting wine. Lots of yellow plum, red apple, and loads of minerality.

title: Dante Rivetti Langhe DOC Arneis Briccodoro 2018
Description: Straw yellow with greenish nuances. A fresh nose, with aromas of exotic fruit on the expansive bouquet. Very fresh and drinkable on the palate.

title: Weinhauss Bettina Shumann Weissburgunder dry 2018 Pinot Blanc
Description: Fermented in oak barrelts gives this pinot blanc a fine, woody scent. On the palate the acidity is crisp. Serve chilled.

title: Ciu Ciu Tebaldo White Blend Organic 2018
Description: This is made from Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, and Sauvignon Blanc grapes. Expect notes of yellow plum, white flowers, and sweet herbs on the palate. It's crisp and refreshing, with enough weight for hors d'oeuvres and a variety of other dishes. Certified organic.
By:: Societa Agricola Ciu Ciu Di Ba

title: Bonnet Huteau Les Gautronnieres Organic 2018
Description: A subdued nose offers chalky and alkaline notes that reprise on a relatively broad, soft palate otherwise dominated by vaguely appley fruit. The finish is sustained and refreshing albeit low-key and not especially bright. Certified Organic.

title: Bonnet Huteau Les Laures Organic 2018
Description: From pure granite soils, the citrus-coloured Muscadet Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Les Laures displays a very clear, slightly flinty, lemon-flavoured nose that indicates a perfect ripeness of Melon de Bourgogne. Certified Organic.

title: Duseigneur Châteauneuf-du-Pape Catarin White 2018
Description: An interesting, medium-bodied white that has plenty of apple, lime and citrus blossom aromas that are carried by a saline-like minerality. Fresh, balanced and with juicy acidity, it's a well done white to drink over the coming couple of years. Certified Biodynamic.

title: Domaine Le Verger Chablis 2018
Description: The Kimmeridgian limestone soils of Chablis are a principal reason the region is the global benchmark for crisp, minerally Chardonnay. This one comes from vines that average 20-40 years of age. You can expect lip-smacking freshness, with white flowers, citrus, and a saline mineral note that will make it a great option for shellfish.

title: Escada Reserva Arinto 2018
Description: It's a bright white, fruited, refreshing with apple and lemon notes in the aroma and tasting. It's a pleasant and elegant easy drinking wine.

title: Piemonte Chardonnay DOC 2017
Description: Straw yellow in color with typical light green hues, this white wine is delicate and persistent on the nose, with scent of banana, and green apple. Fine, velvety, harmonic, medium to full bodied and very well-balanced with a special great rich finish.

title: Saarfeilser GG 2016
Description: This is a really special wine. ''VDP Großes Gewächs'' (GG) indicates that the wine must be dry in style; the designation is also an indicator of the highest quality in German wines. It specifically denotes dry Riesling coming from the best single vineyards - comparable to Grand Cru sites in Burgundy. As the name suggests, this particular vineyard sits on a warm, south-facing slope overlooking the Saar River.

title: Agronika Passerina 2018
Description: A little-known varietal, indigenous to the Marche and small areas of Lazio and Abruzzo, Passerina crafts medium-bodied, fresh whites that retain freshness, even in hot climates. This particular gem offers notes of ripe grapefruit, petrichor and lime on the nose. On the palate, the citrus replays, along with a hint of rosewater and some typistic almond. Stylistically reminiscent of quality Trebbiano, it is sleek and easy-drinking, but has the guts to stand up to a plate of pasta with anchovies. 90 pts Luca Maroni

title: Spier Seaward Chenin Blanc 2017
Description: Fresh aromas of white peach, citrus, quince and honey blossom. The palate offers generous fresh fruit and lively acidity on the finish.

title: Saumaize Michelin Macon Villages 2016
Description: Regular and consistent, this estate delivers wines that express the beautiful terroirs of the Mâconnais. The recipe is simple: work the soil, control yields, look for mature maturities and do not exceed 15% new barrels. The domaine works biodynamically even though they do not have the certification. This Macon Villages comes from old plots. It benefits from a clay / silt soil. Very good quality fruit, fresh with some hints of muscat. Good balance between the fleshiness derived from a couple of years of age and the tension of still-crisp acidity.

title: Saumaize Michelin Macon Vergisson 2016
Description: Regular and consistent, this estate delivers wines that express the beautiful terroirs of the Mâconnais. The recipe is simple: work the soil, control yields, look for mature maturities and do not exceed 15% new barrels. The domaine works biodynamically even though they do not have the certification. The Vergisson is a high altitude vineyard on a rocky soil. This wine is mineral and tight. Aromas of citrus, peach and pear. The palate is very precise with crisp acidity and a saline minerality, yet with a long finish.

title: Perlage Terre di Chieti delle Venezie Organic 2018
Description: This is a blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia. Expect notes of almonds, melon, and banana. It's dry, fresh, and clean on the finish. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Encostas De Favaios Branco
Description: Citrus, with tropical and floral notes. In the mouth it has a medium body and tastes fresh and elegant.

title: Chateau Dereszla Tokaji Szamorodni Dry 2015
Description: Dry Furmint, made of the same grapes that yields the Aszu is a fresh, young, very drinkable wine for all occasions.

title: Perlage Fattoria Bianco Molise Organic
Description: This is a blend of different white grapes from Molise, grown biodynamically. Expect notes of apples and dried fruits. It's clean and crisp, with medium body and good finish. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Perlage Verdiso del Veneto Autochit Organic 2018
Description: The Verdiso grape vine finds its ideal enviroment in the areas where the winter is harsh and the spring is slow to arrive. This is a subtle wine, with hints of fruit, and lots of mineral character. It's fresh and clean, with a crisp, dry finish. Certified Organic and Vegan.

title: Villa Maria Reserve Late Harvest No 2011
Description: Attractive Sémillon aromas and rich concentration are accompanied by intense Noble Botrytis characters of guava, mango and dried fruits. The palate is characteristically mouthfilling displaying an array of citrus varietal fruit flavours, root ginger and honeyed botrytis nuances. This intensely flavoured wine exhibits a finely balanced acidity and will gain further complexity and integration with careful cellaring.

title: Château de Beaucastel Châteauneuf-du-Pape Blanc 2019
Description: While the old-vine Roussanne cuvée from this estate gets all the attention from collectors, don't make the mistake of discounting their classic Châteauneuf du Pape Blanc. The 2019 reveals a lighter gold hue as well as a beautiful and classic bouquet of honeyed citrus, quince, white flowers, bee's wax, and a touch of flinty minerality. Playing in the medium to full-bodied end of the spectrum, it has flawless balance, nicely integrated acidity, and a great, minerally finish. You can enjoy bottles today with a decant or cellar for two to three decades, if you're so inclined. Maturity: 2020-2027. Score - 95. (Jeb Dunnuck, jebdunnuck.com, Oct. 6, 2020)

title: Stonestreet Upper Barn Chardonnay 2016
Description: The 2016 Chardonnay Upper Barn Vineyard comes from the oldest vines on the estate, planted in 1982. Fermented in barrel and aged for 11 months in 47% new French oak, it is a little closed to begin, slowly unfurling to reveal pink grapefruit, white peaches and Granny Smith apples with nuances of honeysuckle, lemon tart and praline. Medium to full-bodied, it explodes in the mouth with citrus and savory layers, with a gorgeous silkiness and loads of ginger and mineral sparks coming through on the finish. Wow! Drink date: 2019-2028. Score - 97+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2019)

title: Domaine William Fèvre Vaillons Chablis 1er Cru
F Reserva White 2017
Description: Very fresh and complex with citrus, grapefruit, floral, vanilla, toast and mineral notes. Finishes long and fresh.

title: Giesen Pure Light Pinot Gris 2018
Description: Delicate pear blossom aromatics with sweet spice. The palate is light yet textural, with flavours of quince paste and papaya.

title: Degenfeld Tokaji Muscat Blanc 2017
Description: A fine white wine with a silvery tint in the glass. On the nose spring flowers and elder. Mature, fruity aftertaste that stays long.

title: Degenfeld Furmint Dry 2016
Description: Pure aromas, disinctly fruity. Lemon, lime and green apple dominate. On the palate it is young, crisp, with a slightly salty minerality.

title: Vivi Vermentino IGT Toscana 2018
Description: This wine has a very intense scent of fresh floral notes with a little mineral hint. The taste is fresh, full, and pleasant. The balanced acidity gives freshness with persistent flavours and makes it a perfect aperitif on a summer evening. Ideal service temperature is 8 - 10 °C. Ideal to drink by itself, or paired with vegetables, seafood, salads and soft cheeses.

title: Terra De Lobos White 2018
Description: Citrine in colour with an aromatic explosion of passion fruit and apricot notes, combined with a green and fresh character from the Sauvignon Blanc. Superb freshness and acidity on the palate, giving this wine balance, elegance and medium-long persistence. Ideal as an aperitif, with light dishes, grilled fish, seafood and oriental cuisine.

title: Atma Red 2017
Description: Hailing from the hills of Macedonia, this brilliant, light yellow wine is a blend of Malagousia and Xinomavro grapes. Light floral aromas and sweet exotic fruits, banana and honeysuckle are buoyed by a fresh, light, silky mouthfeel and linger in the long and pleasant aftertaste.

title: Grele Greco Di Tufo DOCG 2018
Description: Brilliant and clear, straw-yellow colour, aromas are complex and fruit flavoured. On taste it is well balanced. Serve with appetizers, white meats, first course (especially pasta) and fish.

title: Kanonkop Kadette Pinotage 2017
Description: A complex wine with hints of red fruit and mocha flavours. Elegant tannin structures with a good length and dry finish. Can mature for a further 6 - 8 years.

title: Grandilla Falanghina IGT 2018
Description: It's a well blended wine yellow in colour with golden tint. Broom, pineapple and apricot aromas are combined with spicy hints of cinnamon and hazelnut. The fat taste is kept fresh by the mineral and acid characteristic typical of the grape. Serve with appetizers, white meats, first course (especially pasta) and fish.

title: Riolite Castel del Lago Soave 2018
Description: This will be a crisp, refreshing Soave that shows aromas of chamomile and grapefruit, with a silky, spicy, balanced finish. The food-friendly texture will pair well with green salads or freshwater fish.[Luca Maroni tasting note not available.] Score - 96. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, Feb. 21, 2019)

title: Masso Antico Fiano del Salento 2018
Description: (Translated from the Italian) Spectacularly soft taste to the senses, with a prominent acidity profile laying in the mellifluous, dense and viscous grape pulp. Every sip brings absolute harmony of fruit and flower. This wine reveals an excellent thickness and a respectful and complete production process of transformation. Score - 97. (Luca Maroni, lucamaroni.com, March 7, 2019)

title: Chateau Dereszla Tokaji Aszu 6 Puttonyos 2009
Description: The Tokaji Aszu 6 Puttonyos, the King of Tokaj dessert wines. Very sweet, almost honey-like , it hugs the palate. Serve it chilled; will keep until 2050.

title: Luna Gaia Mandricardo Catarratto 2018
Description: On the nose notes of ripe melon and echoes of lychee, on the palate dominates the citrus flavour typical of the grape variety. Firm body with lots of fabric and fine enamel.

title: Quinta de Sanjoanne Superior 2015
Description: Less than 5% of the wines of Vinho Verde achieve 'Superior' status as judged by the independent Vinho Verde Association. This gorgeous blend of Alvarinho and Malvasia Fina opens with flint, citrus and crushed white flower notes on the nose. The palate is nervy and vibrant, tingling with mouthwatering acidity; there is a surprising intensity, with plenty of depth. The flint and citrus continues from the nose to the palate, but there are notes of apricot and peach, ripe pear and a long, petrichor-laced finish. Perfect with grilled sardines or fried smelts in olive oil and garlic, spring salads, or simply enjoyed on its own with good conversation. 92 pts - Robert Parker.
By:: Casa De Cello Gestao Rural, Lda

title: Quinta do Covão Reserva Encruzado 2015
Description: Presents a citrus colour with light golden tones, aroma with fruit notes of white pulp and wood very well integrated in the mouth reveals freshness with good structure and complexity that gives it a long and persistent finish.

title: Verrazzano Vin Santo Reserva 2003
Description: Warm flavours of honey and caramel with aromas of flowers, peaches and toasty oak.

title: RELAX Pinot Grigio 2018
Description: RELAX Pinot Grigio is a light to medium-bodied wine boasting peach, citrus, pear and green apple flavours with a bright, crisp acidity and fresh, lingering finish. It's perfect on its own or as a complement to a variety of light foods like salads, seafood, poultry and pastas.

title: Dr. Loosen Erdener Treppchen Riesling Spatlese 2017
Description: The Spatlese ('late harvest') designation means that the grapes have achieved a ripeneness above the Kabinett level. The Erdener Treppchen Spatlese, from a truly top vineyard site that belongs to the village of Erden, is a fruit-driven Riesling.

title: Rallo Passito di Pantelleria 2015
Description: Passito di Pantelleria is an Italian DOC for Moscato wines made from dried grapes grown in Italy's most southerly territory, the island of Pantelleria. In Sicily Moscato is called Zibibbo, which means 'raisin' in Arabic. The grapes are grown in vine 'baskets' to protect them from the winds. Grapes are either left to dry on the vine or in special drying rooms. The result is a wine that is produced in miniscule quantities and very sweet, yet balanced by acidity to keep it fresh. A light amber colour with intense yet sweet, elegant and well-balanced with notes of orange peel, apricots, dried figs and honey with impressive acidity.

title: Peter Zemmer Crivelli Riserva Chardonnay 2016
Description: Peter Zemmer makes bold wines that are determined in their territorial identity. The 2016 Alto Adige Chardonnay Riserva Crivelli offers a strong citrus character with lemon curd and grapefruit concentrate. Those are the high notes, but the low notes veer toward toasted almond and pine nut. The wine opens to an off-gold color with spice and natural rubber. Despite the delicate bouquet, the wine fans over the palate to reveal a firm, mid-weight palate. Drink date: 2018-2025. Score - 93. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

title: Schiopetto Friulano 2017
Description: Incredible aromas of cloves, nutmeg, peaches, pears and cooked apples. Yet, always so refined and perfumed. Full-bodied, dense and very tight and focused. A fabulous bottle here. Drink or hold. Score - 95. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 25, 2018)

title: Cantine Rallo AV01 Catarato Orange Organic 2018
Description: AV01 is a rich and intense Sicilian wine, with slightly orange tints and with a strong character, produced with spontaneous fermentation in acacia barrels and steel tanks and with maceration on the skins for 24 hours. It has aromas of tangerine, chamomile, roasted almonds and dried herbs. The taste is very fresh with bright and lively acidity, quite structured with some tannic backbone and notable minerality. Organic with no added sulfites and unfiltered.

title: Pacheca Grande Reserva 2018
Description: Pacheca Touriga Nacional is an elegant wine with good aromatic intensity, notes of bergamot and violet with well-integrated wood. It reveals good structure in the mouth, rounded tannins, freshness, and a long and persistent finish.
By:: Quinta Da Pacheca Soc. Agricola E T

title: Dr. Loosen Urziger Wurzgarten Riesling Grosses Gewachs Reserve 2013
Description: Blazing red and insanely steep, this vineyard fills a picturesque amphitheater formed by a dramtic bend in the Mosel River. Wines from the Urziger Wurzgarten can often display exotic and spicy aromas as well as a mesmerizing earthiness. No other vineyard on the Mosel produces wines so bursting with tropical fruit flavors. The estate's oldest vines are found here.

title: Lunaria Civitas Pecorino 2018
Description: Straw yellow, intense nose with white pulp. The palate is fresh, intense, fruity and full bodied.

title: Papagiannakos Savatiano Old Vines 2018
Description: Bright gold and clear in colour, delicate bouquet, aroma of citrus. Medium acidity, long and pleasant aftertaste. A fine accompaniment to Mediterranean dishes, seafood, fish, and white meat.

title: Koncho Alazanis Valley White 2018
