Description: Fresh, rich aroma with notes of apple, pear and honey. Soft and harmonious, this wine shows hints of baked apple and candied fruits.

title: Koncho Rkatsiteli Kakheti 2018
Description: Complex aroma of ripe and dried yellow fruits, white plum, pear and peach. Harmonious taste of wine has a mineral structure and a complex palate of fruit shades. Soft, fresh, with pleasant acidity and long pleasant finish.

title: Domaine Blanc 2018
Description: Shiny and straw colour. Subtle nose of candied citrus and star anise. Onctuous, flavourful and tonic month. Very nice pairing with poultry and goat cheese such as pélardon. Ageing capacity 2-3 years.

title: Le Bouquet Blanc 2018
Description: Pale yellow robe with silver gleams. Attractive nose of citrus, fresh ananas, clementines, acacia and lime tree. On the palate, tonic with a refreshing lime finale. Enjoy as an apéritif, with goat cheese or grilled fish like sea bass with fennel. Ageing capacity 2-3 years.

title: Luna Gaia Maganza Zibibbo 2018
Description: Zibibbo is the Sicilian name for the grape variety Muscat d'Alexandrie. The large family of Muscat grapes stands for wonderfully aromatic wines. So here too: In the bouquet subtle notes of nutmeg and cedar. On the palate a lot of juice, reminiscent of ripe apricots. Nice game between acidity and fruit sweetness.

title: Liegenfeld Welschriesling Hofsatz 2019
Description: Fragrant with fruity bouquet of apple and citrus. Freshness on the palate, with lively acidity.

title: Liegenfeld Grüner Veltliner Classic 2019
Description: Youthful bouquet, fuity taste, fine acidity, elegant and adherent.

title: Bellone Bianco Lazio IGT 2018
Description: Deep yellow with a golden tint, the Bellone evokes sunshine and ripe tropical fruit such as mango and papaya. The fruit is nicely balanced by a marked acidity which makes it suitable for long bottle aging. On the palate, it is rich, ample, with a zesty tang that lingers in a long finish.
By:: Casale Del Giglio Soc. Agr. S.

title: Banyan Gewurztraminer 2018
Description: Made from 100% Gewurztraminer, this vegan-friendly wine underwent some added skin-contact time while in transport to the winery, boosting the aromatics and savoury flavours. It brings tropical aromatics on the nose with lots of melon and lychee on the palate, and an herbal note.

title: Niepoort Redoma Reserva Branco 2018
Description: 92 Wine Advocate '...a blend of Baga (40%), Jaen (30%) and various others (30%), aged for 20 months in used 2,000-liter fuders. This is a classic Dão, fresh, flavorful and elegant in this vintage. Showing fine tension and moderate tannins on the finish, this finishes with plums and cherries, dry and focused.'

title: DogRidge Away Game Riesling 2018
Description: 'Away game' refers to the wine being made in Clare Valley, which has perfect conditions for making Riesling. Expect notes of kaffir lime, pears, and lots of crisp minerality on the finish.

title: Ruelas VB IGP Lisboa 2018
Description: Citrus colour wine, with fruity and fresh aromas. Good acidity and well-balanced in the mouth, with a very pleasant end.

title: Maison Tramier Bouzeron 2018
Description: The nose evokes acacia, white flowers, and hazel-bordered country lanes. Flinty mineral notes and lemon complete a classic bouquet, to which may sometimes be added a discreet touch of honey or warm croissant. In the mouth its meaty, well-built body and luxurious vivacity brings out the distinct personality of the Aligoté grape.

title: Gaia Monograph Moschofilero 2019
Description: The coolness of the Arkadian plateau, at 700 m altitude, lends to this Moschofilero considerable aromatic intensity, as well as the acidity required for the making of this youthful and pleasant wine. Aromas of rose, typical for Moschofilero, dominate from the very first moment and its ''mountainous'' acidity gives crispness and a great potential for gustatory associations.

title: Jean Bourdy Côtes du Jura Savagnin 2016
Description: Powerful aromas in the nose. A little bit fruity (green apple) but strong minerality with some spices (curry). Also big power in the mouth. Huge freshness, complex, very long, but also fine and elegant. Better if uncorked 2 or 3 hours before drinking at a temperature of (at least) 16° Celsius.

title: Casa-Dea Chardonnay 2016
Description: Featuring apple, lemon, ripe pear and smoke, this Chardonnay is crisp with a complex, round texture. Smoke, vanilla, butterscotch and a long, creamy finish. Pair with veal chops and mashed potatoes. (Vintages panel, March 2019)

title: Villa Maria Clifford Bay Reserve Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: Dry, concentrated sauvignon blanc with passionfruit, nettle, oyster shell and mineral flavours. Quite a textural wine with good weight and length. A pretty wine with good regional and varietal identity. Drink 2018-2022. Score - 94. (Bob Campbell, MW, therealreview.com, Sept. 10, 2018)

title: Bruce Jack Chenin Blanc 2018
Description: Though native to the Loire, Chenin Blanc is the signature white grape of South Africa, where for many years it was known as Steen. This example offers exceptional value, and its orange blossom, beeswax, peach and melon notes make a great starting point for those unfamiliar with the South African version. Try it with spiced grilled chicken skewers. (Vintages panel, June 2019)
By:: Bruce Jack Wines Sa Pty Ltd

title: Cuatro Rayas Vendemio Nocturna Verdejo 2018
Description: Crisp, clean lime and passion fruit aromas are true to Verdejo. Offering a juicy, bright palate, flavors of orange, lime and green herbs finish with citrus and lettuce notes. Drink as soon as possible. Best Buy. Score - 90. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2019)
By:: Sociedade Agricola Casa De Vila Nov

title: Joseph Drouhin Les Clos Mâcon-Bussières 2018
Description: Ripe and creamy green fruits. Deep, rich and leesy on the palate. Generous and slightly grainy. Chewy but fresh. Lots of character, almost savoury from the lees. Moreish. When to drink: 2020-2024. Score - 16 (out of 20). (Julia Harding, MW, jancisrobinson.com, Dec. 30, 2019)

title: Granite Hill Chardonnay 2018
Description: Lodi is surely on your radar for Zinfandel, but the rolling hills and the cooling influence of ocean-born breezes create excellent pockets for Chardonnay. This one is lifted and floral, with bright citrus and a boisterous freshness. Well-balanced with just a touch of oak, this crisp Chard will be great with seafood salads, or chicken in a creamy sauce.  (Vintages panel, Aug. 2019)

title: Saddleback Cellars Chardonnay Napa Valley 2017
Description: Aromatic and lively in the glass, the nose hints at passion fruit and nectarine with light oaky vanilla. On the palate, a rush of stone fruit is tempered by toast, leather and minerality. This wine is aromatic and lively.

title: Tarrica Chardonnay Paso Robles 2018
Description: Golden in colour with aromas of tropical fruit, peach, vanilla and hints of sweet oak. Medium bodied and complex with a well-balanced mouth feel offering tropical & stone fruit, mineral and citrus flavours. Ending with a satisfying creamy finish.

title: Schiopetto Pinot Grigio Collio DOC 2018
Description: White wine balanced and beautiful freshness with notes of apple and pear and a final herbs, intense and delicate.

title: Underwood Pinot Gris 2015
Description: Immediately sucks you in. Delicious flavours, great aromatics. Pitches through the drinking zone. Smells of pear, ginger, floral stuff, marzipan. Tastes fresh, white flesh pear fruity, has great length, touch of savouriness and a refreshing finish. There's some richness to texture but it doesn't forget drinkability. It's destined for drinking in the sun, on the water, or similar. It's worth checking in. Drink: 2015-2018. Score - 92. (Mike Bennie, winefront.com.au, Dec. 24, 2015)

title: Tsinandali DOC 2017
Description: Pale-straw white dry wine from Tsinandali PDO Micro-Zone of Kakheti region. Aroma of pears, apples and quince. Full-bodied, with intense flavour of apples, pears, citrus, cedar and vanilla, refreshing acidity and long finish.

title: Dona Ermelinda Branco 2018
Description: The colour of pale-green straw, this wine has an intense, fruity aroma with notes of honey and tropical fruit. Well-rounded on the palate, with a good balance between the acidity, sugars, alcohol and wood. A long-lasting, pleasant and persistent final note.

title: Dreissigacker Weissburgunder Organic 2018
Description: From organic, hand-picked Pinot Blanc grapes, long maceration time up to 48 hours, spontaneous fermentation, maturation in wooden barrels (30%) and stainless steel (70%), extended yeast contact. Pale gold, earthy-mineral scent of dried yellow fruits and delicate floral, nutty notes. Complex with noticeable minerality and finely integrated acidity, good length in the finish. Pairs nicely with vegetarian dishes or fried freshwater fish and green asparagus.

title: Dreissigacker Cuvee White Organic 2018
Description: From organic, hand-harvested Müller-Thurgau, Riesling and Silvaner, maceration up to 18 hours, spontaneous fermentation in stainless steel, maturation in stainless steel (100%). Pale straw, ripe fruit aromas of citrus, apricot, light spice notes. Palate is fresh grapefruit-inspired, medium-bodied, elegant, fresh, well balanced fruit and acidity, long finish. Good on its own or to accompany salads, seafood, crayfish, white meat and vegetarian dishes.

title: Lacrau White 2019
Description: Citrine with good intensity. Young, intense, with good complexity. Hints of citrus and tropical fruits. Dry. Balanced acidity. Good aroma on the palate. Refreshing finish.

title: Domaine Hamelin Beauroy Chablis 1er Cru 2018
Description: Beauroy is one of the warmest premiers crus on the Left Bank and needs to be picked early to retain freshness. The Hamelins' parcel runs to 3.9ha and is now 35 years old, producing a wine with understated power, subtle 10% new wood and flavours of citrus, tangerine and white pepper. A superb rendition of the site. Drinking window 2020-2028. Score - 94. (Tim Atkin, MW, decanter.com, Nov. 15, 2019)

title: San Pietro Gavi DOCG 2018
Description: This is a fresh, clean, and mineral driven Gavi (aka Cortese, aka Gavi di Gavi). Expect similar notes on the palate, backed by hints of melon, white flowers, and almond. The crisp finish keeps you coming back and makes it an excellent pairing with food.
By:: Tenuta San Pietro In Tassarolo Az.

title: Dagueneau Pouilly-sur-Loire La Centenaire 2019
Description: A serious 100% Chasselas from low-yielding old vines, this excellent gastronomic wine offers a subtle bouquet with yeasty aromas intertwined with a highly delicate amalgam of ripe pears, dried apples, hazelnut (blossoms), white peach and apricots.

title: Villa Maria Taylors Pass Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: Our sole Sauvignon Blanc representative in the Best In Show class this year comes from Marlborough rather than any of the key Northern Hemisphere sites, but our judges loved the way in which this was not necessarily obvious from its profile. With its fresh, sappy, crushed-spring-leaf aromas and limpid, long, vinous yet tender profile in the mouth, this is simply great Sauvignon from an outstanding site rather than one of the overt or flamboyant Marlborough Sauvignons drinkers have become used to (and sometimes bored by). There's no shortage of charm either, though, with its whispered sweet-pea floral notes. Pretty and distracting enough to serve on its own on a warm afternoon, but with all the structure and sap to accompany food well, too. Marlborough is moving on. Platinum - Best in Show. Drink 2019-2022. Score - 97. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Submission Chardonnay 2017
Description: Crafted in a spot-on Californian style that offers creamy richness and intense ripe fruit. There's lots of apple pie and vanilla here, as well as driving freshness and a pure, refined mineral undertone. It has a winning, pleasing softness that makes it a delight to taste. Pair with grilled chicken, pulled pork or ribs. (Vintages panel, Aug. 2019)

title: Poesia Garnacha Blanca 2018
Description: There's a very fresh array of lemons and pears on offer here with a smooth, crisp and direct feel on the palate. Drink now. Score - 90. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 26, 2019)

title: San Sisto Riserva Verdicchio Castelli di Jesi Classico 2016
Description: Fresh and fruity white with sliced-pear and pineapple flavors. Ripe fruit with acidity here. Drink now [till 2023+]. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 7, 2019)

title: MRO Ried Hundschupfen 2018
Description: On the palate very elegant; peppery-spicy in taste. Exotic fruity flavours; mineral components on the palate; citric notes on the tongue. Good balance with a finish of distinguished harmony.

title: MRO Weinviertel DAC 2018
Description: Luscious on the palate; fine peppery spiciness; fresh-fruity; remarkable notes of pear; good aftertaste.

title: Mount Fishtail Sauvignon Blanc 2019
Description: Typical Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc aromas of grapefruit, gooseberry, and lime. The palate is fresh and vibrant with notes of honeydew melon and zippy acidity.

title: Gotes Blanques 2017
Description: The grapes used to produce this wine come from vineyards that are situated at considerable altitudes between the towns of Cornudella and Morera del Montsant. The vines grow on calcareous and slate soils, a characteristic trait of the region. The grapes are harvested manually and fermentation takes place in stainless steel tanks and finishes in the same tanks, where the wine ages for 5 months on its lees.

title: Roman Road Chardonnay 2018
Description: Made from 100%, estate-grown Chardonnay. Fermented in a combination of stainless steel and 1-year old French barrels. Aged for 9 months in barrel prior to bottling in June, 2019. Exuding a true sense of place, this elegant, single vineyard, still Chardonnay is created from fruit specially selected for its maturity and concentration. It displays pineapple and apricot aromas, complemented with sweet oak, clementine and mixed spice flavours and finishing in a luxurious, textured palate.

title: Frey-Sohler Grand Cru Frankstein 2013
Description: The Frey-Sohler estate has evolved through several generations, all intimately linked with the village and the wines of Alsace. Exceptional wine that comes from 30 year old vines located on complex granitic area (quartz and feldspar). This Grand Cru has a golden colour. High complexity on the nose with notes of spices, honey, exotic fruits and acacia flowers. It's the perfect time to drink this wine now as it needs to lay down for a few years after the harvest to show all its potential ! Exceptional value.

title: Derringstone Pinot Meunier 2018
Description: Created from exclusively estate grown and hand-picked Pinot Meunier grapes, this intriguing and truly unique 'blanc de noirs' was carefully vinified as a white wine. The Derringstone Pinot Meunier displays chalk purity and sweet and savoury aromas of poached winter fruit. Complex balsamic nuances and red fruit flavours finish with a deliciously creamy mouth-feel.

title: Qvevris Rkatsiteli Kakheti Tbilvino 2017
Description: Wine is amber in colour, has a well-balanced tannin structure and offers aromas of apricot and pear. Due to the specific production technology, a small amount of sediment may be produced in the bottle. Qvevris Rkatsiteli goes well with veal, lamb and barbeque of any kind.

title: Château des Quarts Pouilly-Fuissé Clos de Quarts 2012
Description: The 2012 Pouilly-Fuissé 'Clos des Quarts' has a wonderful bouquet with ethereal floral notes: touches of white chocolate and almond, all with outstanding precision and mineralité. The palate is tense on the entry, very focused with layers of ripe citric fruit, a lot of minerality and a touch of orange zest on the tensile finish. This marks an impressive debut (in terms of control of the vineyard) but there is much much more to come. Score 92, Neal Martin, The Wine Advocate, Oct 2014

title: Tblilvino Qvevris Kisi 2016
Description: Nuanced and structured with characteristically mineral and herbal flavours and aromas. You can also discern citrus, gooseberry and blackcurrant notes in these wines. Crisp acids add the necessary structure, making them an ideal accompaniment to food. Serve with fish, seafood dishes as well as slightly stronger flavours.

title: Longview Queenie 2019
Description: Grown on a south-western facing slope atop the Longview estate, this Pinot Grigio shows all the hallmarks of a traditional Italian style. The nose is overflowing with nashi pear and white blossom notes. The palate is crisp and dry with delicate green apple fruit, bright acidity and a textural finish.

title: Deiss Pinot Gris 2015
Description: 91 points Wine Advocate 'Deiss's 2015 Pinot Gris is clear and fresh on the nose, with concentrated lemon aromas intertwining with crushed limestone flavors. Rich, round and intense on the palate, this is a full-bodied, clear and mineral Pinot with a vital acidity and a lingering salinity. The wine is semi-dry and reveals a very fine tannin structure. It is more clear and fresh on nose and palate than the 2013 due to less botrytis, but more overripe grapes instead.'

title: Deiss Grand Cru Altenberg de Berghe 2012
Description: 95+ points Stephan Reinhardt (Wine Advocate Oct 2015) 'intense and precise fruit aromas of ripe peaches, white cacao, vanilla and honey... Sweet and very elegant on the first palate, this full-bodied, powerful and tension-filled wine reveals a stunning precision, typical limestone freshness and finesse.'

title: Wieninger Ried Kaasgraben Grüner Veltliner 2018
Description: Wieninger's Ried Kaasgraben opens with a clear, fresh, elegant and very aromatic bouquet of ripe white and yellow fruits intertwined with delicate spicy/mineral aromas. It's round and fresh on the palate, with delicate, perfectly integrated acidity and remarkable finesse. This is an elegant, vital and mineral Grüner Veltliner with a long, well-structured and clear finish.

title: Muros Antigos Alvarinho 2019
Description: Citrus aromas, tropical, but with great complexity. Full-bodied, good structure and very bitter and dry finish of Alvarinho.

title: Quintessence White 2018
Description: A complex nose that mixes aromas of white flowers and exotic fruits (pineapple) and spices (saffron, curry). On the palate, ample and round. Rich and balanced at the same time, with a good freshness, saltiness, and a powerful aromatic intensity. Ideal as an aperitif, gorgeous pairing with truffles, white meats, fishes, warmed pâte cheeses (comté), refined goat cheeses.

title: Lugana DOC Montunal 2018
Description: An intense pale yellow colour with brilliant hues, on the nose it offers floral and fruity scents, dominated by aromas of white peach and lemon zest, with balsamic hints of thyme and sage and an intriguing mineral impression of wet stones that is so typical in Lugana wines possessing a strong personality.

title: Domaine Roland Schmitt Pinot Blanc 2019
Description: Beautiful yellow colour with a green, bright and crystalline reflection. Very elegant nose that evolves when aerated (aromas of fruit, ripe pears), subtle floral notes (white flowers, hawthorns) and toasted bread notes. Very fine mouth on the fruit aromas of the grape. This Pinot Blanc will accompany with brilliance your every day dinners and your improvised evenings with friends.

title: Domaine Palon Vacqueyras Blanc du Bary 2018
Description: This luscious, refreshing white was crafted from 80% Clairette and 20% Grenache Blanc, both hand-picked from vines averaging more than forty-five years of age. The yield was 30 hl/ha! It is a clear, bright yellow-gold colour with a vibrant nose of bananas, grilled almonds, peaches, pears, honeysuckle, vanilla, exotic spices, toast and minerals. It is very smooth and extremely well balanced - lots of fruit offset by a gorgeous acidity. It is fresh, complex and rich with wonderful flavours of peaches and pears. It would be perfect, served at about 8°C, with trout almandine, shell fish, fish, goat cheese and rich poultry dishes. Drinking well now and will keep for up to 5 years.

title: Domaine Chauviniere Muscadet Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie 2018
Description: Super-fresh nose with lovely grapefruit, melon and a touch of musky grape-juice scent too. Beautiful salinity and refreshment on the finish, although the acid is quite soft and fluffy. Medium body, reasonable persistence. A great example of classic Muscadet in soft focus. Drink 2019-2022. Score - 16 (out of 20). (Richard Hemming, MW, jancisrobinson.com, April 5, 2019)

title: ME by Matahiwi Estate Pinot Gris 2019
Description: Attractively fruited and elegantly fragrant, the wine shows ripe peach, fresh pear, rockmelon and floral characters. It is equally appealing on the palate, delivering youthful charm and bright fruit flavours, beautifully complemented by silky texture and refreshing acidity. At its best: now to 2021. Score - 91. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, July 2019)

title: Weinviertel Haide Grüner Veltliner 2019
Description: Light straw-yellow in colour with a scent of freshly picked apples, citrus and peach. On the palate the full fruit comes alive again, ripe apples, peach and fresh tropical fruits. Mineral structure in the whole mouth, spices and pepper in the finish.

title: Casal de Ventozela Branco Escolha 2018
Description: Lots of yellow and red apples on the nose here. Follow up with some citrus and plum on the palate. Bright and fresh with a slight efflorescence to give it a nice lift.

title: Badel Grasevina Vezak Kvalitetna Slavonia
Description: Grasevina (also known as Welschrieslig, Riesling Italico, Laski Rizling, Olasz Rizling) Daruvar has a deep straw yellow colour with greenish reflexes. Modern and popular wine, fresh with perfectly balanced vivacious fruity aromas, unique, light palate and pleasant smoothness. The balance between the fresh and pure flavour of Grasevina Vezak combined with apple, pear and peach notes will please modern wine connoisseurs.

title: Badel Sauvignon Vezak Vrhunska Slavonia
Description: Unique wine with opulent, perfectly balanced aromas of elder, tropical fruits, and grapefruit. Wine with excellent structure, expressed acidity, balanced body, fresh and pleasant. Texture almost oily, aroma both fruity and grassy, lingering aftertaste. Gastronomic wine perfect for serving with a wide range of dishes.

title: Suadens Bianco 2018
Description: Fresh and fragrant on the palate, notes of typical fruits that aren't cultivated anywhere else.

title: Domaine Ponsot Clos des Monts Luisants Morey-Saint-Denis 1er Cru 2017
Description: The 2017 Morey-Saint-Denis 1er Cru Clos des Monts Luisants Blanc bursts from the glass with aromas of crisp green orchard fruit, waxy citrus rind, orange oil and warm pastry. Medium to full-bodied, fine-boned and elegant, it's chalky and incisive, with fine concentration and cut, concluding with a precise, mineral finish. Drink date: 2025-2045. Score - 93. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Feb. 13, 2020)

title: Domaine du Chene Viognier 2018
Description: This Viognier is made outside of the appellation Condrieu, Northern part of the Rhône Valley (IGP Collines Rhodaniennes). It comes from a plot named 'Les gardes' with a high proportion of granite in the soil. Hand harvested, the wine is aged 8 months in oak barrel and in tank. Rich white wine with refined flavours and long lasting finish. Great value!

title: Aromo Private Reserve Chardonnay 2019
Description: This Chardonnay is fermented in a combination of oak and stainless steel. You can expect a wine with a generous mouthfeel and texture, with apple, pear and spice notes.

title: Giglio Grillo Sicilia DOC Biologico 2019
Description: Grillo is the flagship of Sicily's indigenous white varieties, with its aromatic and floral nose. Fresh and harmonious on the well-structured palate with a long and elegant finish.
By:: Cantine Giglio Sas Di Giglio Tommas

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert Racines et Terroirs Riesling 2018
Description: Subtle Golden Delicious apple notes have an edge of fragrant grapefruit peel on the nose of this wine. The palate then gives full rein to that juicy, mellow apple ripeness, conveying both freshness and texture. This wine is fresh, harmonious and mild, all the way to the dry finish. Score - 90. (Anne Krebiehl, MW, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2019)

title: Invivo Sauvignon Blanc 2019
Description: Fabulously fruited and intensely aromatic, the bouquet shows passionfruit, feijoa and green rockmelon characters with a hint of musky complexity. The palate is succulent and persistent with excellent fruit intensity backed by refreshing acidity, finishing impressively long and tasty. At its best: now to 2022. Score - 94. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, Sept. 2020)

title: La Scalata Pinot Grigio Orange Wine 2017
Description: Tenuous coppery colour that tends to amber. Enveloping and fresh on the nose with notes of green hazelnut, mandarin and pink grapefruit alternating with more vegetable scents. Smooth and delicate, in the mouth it is also appreciated for its complexity and structure, persistence and a bitter finish. Excellent with all fish-based preparations.

title: DPA Puligny Montrachet 1er Cru Champs Gains 2013
Description: Bright golden colour with greenish highlights; Nose of lemongrass, minerals and hawthorne blossoms; Refreshing lemon and citrus on the palate. Body and bouquet blend into subtle harmony.
By:: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

title: Manincor Reserve Della Contessa 2019
Description: Grape varieties: Pinot Blanc 55%, Chardonnay 30%, Sauvignon Blanc 15% (Terlaner DOC). Fermentation was done in oak barrels with indigenous wild yeasts and aged 9 months on the lees before bottling. Bright gold with green tinges. Nose filled with aromas of apple, apricot and a hint of sage; tightly-knit, extremely elegant on the palate with a refreshing finish. Enjoy at optimum maturity now to the end of 2026. Great matched with roast salmon, simple appetizers and white meats.
By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

title: Manincor La Manina 2019
Description: 50:30:20 Pinot Blanc, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc. Partial wild yeast ferment. Bright yellow with greenish reflexes. Ripe fruit flavours of quince, lychee and pink grapefruit with fresh herbal aromas of sage and mint. Enjoy now to the end of 2023. Delicious as an aperitif it makes a wonderful partner to roasted fillet of salmon, appetizers and white meats. Certified biodynamic.
By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

title: Manincor Moscato Giallo 2019
Description: 'Grape variety: 100% Goldmuskateller ('Golden Muscat'). Fermentation in oak and stainless steel tanks, partial wild yeast-fermentation, matured on lees for five months before bottling. Intense golden yellow in colour, this seductive wine displays an intense parfum with notes of nutmeg, cedar, apricot supported by a streak of racy, vibrant acidity. Enjoy at optimum maturity now to the end of 2023. Delicious as an aperitif it makes a wonderful partner to spicy Chinese and Thai foods or mature hard cheeses.'
By:: Manincor Sas Az Agr Di Michael Goes

title: Remy Pannier Vouvray 2018
Description: This fragrant wine has an inviting, balanced sweetness, with touches of apple, honey and lime and a fine, notable minerality. It will be great for spicy dishes such as orange beef or sushi and will pair with a wide range of Pacific Rim cuisine. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2019)

title: Decelle Côtes du Rhône-Villages Blanc 2018
Description: White wines from the Rhône are always exciting, and this well-priced Côtes du Rhône-Villages offers loads of apricot, pear, and orange zest, with great length, a characterful minerality and an earthy component. An easy option for grilled veal, pork or seafood. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

title: Quinta D'Amares Alvarinho 2019
Description: Citrus, with lemonade nuances. Tropical fruits, floral, with a touch of tangerine. Complex structure in the mouth, balanced with prolonged freshness.

title: La Tunella Chardonnay 2018
Description: A well-balanced, fresh white wine, offering flavours of yellow pear, stone and spring blossom. Lightly mouthwatering on the clean-cut finish.

title: Handley Estate Vineyard Chardonnay 2016
Description: This wine shows aromas of apple blossoms, poached pear, toasted coconut, and hints of spicy oak. Flavours of pear, stone fruit, and citrus swirl on the palate. It is medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel finishing with notes of crème fraiche and toasted almond.

title: Chelti Tsinandali 2018
Description: White dry wine with fruity aromas. Light and fresh with peach and apricot notes.

title: Naturalmente Bio Catarratto DOC 2019
Description: This wine is made from indigenous Sicilian grapes organically grown in Marsala. Fresh and clean citrus notes. Elegant and balanced tropical fruit fragrance that ends in a long, mineral finish. Enjoy with any type of easy pasta, grilled seafood or white meat.

title: Louis Michel & Fils Butteaux Vieilles Vignes Chablis 1er Cru 2017
Description: A formidable rendition of this reliably superb cuvée, Michel's 2017 Chablis 1er Cru Butteaux Vieilles Vignes wafts from the glass with a complex but reserved bouquet of fresh peach, crisp yellow apple, iodine, mandarin oil and paraffin wax. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, deep, dense and concentrated, with a racy spine of acidity cloaked in vibrant fruit, concluding with a long, searingly saline finish. This is well worth seeking out. Drink date: 2023-2040. Score - 94. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2019)

title: Hiller Gruner Veltliner Pulkau 2019
Description: Light yellow-green in colour. Lively primary aromas of apple, blossom honey and nuts followed by hearty spice, enticing freshness and a round, creamy texture finishing with supportive citrus acidity. This lends it to be a mouth-watering aperitif and versatile food accompaniment.

title: Benito Santos Albarino 2019
Description: Light, green-tinged yellow. Lively, precise scents of lemon zest, quince, mint and dusty minerals, with a suave floral overtone. Dry, racy and focused, offering vibrant citrus and orchard fruit flavours that put on weight with air while retaining vivacity. This bracing wine finishes spicy, stony and very long.

title: Esporão Private Selection White 2018
Description: This is a rare example of a 100% Sémillon wine from Portugal, perhaps inspired by Winemaker David Baverstock's Australian background. Wood aged and ageworthy, it is rich in tropical fruits, spice and toastiness. While it could be enjoyed now, it will be even better after 2023. Editors' Choice. Score - 95. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, July 1, 2020)

title: Domaine Chanson Bastion Beaune 1er Cru 2015
Description: This wine is predominantly sourced from vines planted in 2000. Expect an inviting character, lifted floral notes, apple tones and a saline minerality. It will drink well through 2021.

title: Le Macon-Villages de Vicky 2018
Description: Bright gold colour. This is classic Chardonnay with fresh flowers, pears, honey and butter present.The domaine is famous for its terroir of La Cra & Mâcon Burgy in the heart of the Mâconnais. This is a wine made by the Fichet family and a special selection of Miss Vicky each year. Perfect as an apéritif, or with grilled fish, pastas, gratins, goat cheeses and late-summer dishes.

title: Palladino Gavi DOCG Del Comune di Gavi 2019
Description: Minerality on the nose, pear, almond. Fruity start, supported by good acidity that provides freshness against a round background. A slight almond bitter note on the end. The wine is somewhat short and does not have great depth, but it is very fresh, balanced and provides great drinking pleasure.

title: Louis Jadot Morgeot Clos de la Chapelle Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru 2017
Description: A candidate for extended cellaring in Jadot's range this year is the 2017 Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru Morgeot Clos de la Chapelle (Domaine du Duc de Magenta), a beautifully incisive wine that meets the high expectations I formed when I tasted it from barrel a year ago. Opening in the glass with aromas of crisp Anjou pear, peach, fresh pastry and honeycomb, it's medium to full-bodied, elegantly textural and youthfully tight-knit, with fabulous structural tension and a racy spine of acidity. Bottled under Diam 30, this tensile but concentrated Morgeot will really begin to sing in six or seven years. Drink date: 2025-2045. Score - 93+. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Feb. 13, 2020)

title: Maison Louis Jadot Cailleret Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru 2018
Description: The 2018 Chassagne-Montrachet en Cailleret 1er Cru is less expressive on the nose at the moment but finely detailed with more mineralité than its Chassagne siblings, offering crushed rocks mixed with yellow flower and honeysuckle aromas. The palate is very well balanced with a fine line of acidity. Intense, full of energy and cohesive, leading into a beautiful, pure orange-zest-tinged finish with pralines on the aftertaste. Wonderful. Drinking window: 2021-2038. Score - 92-94. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Jan. 2020)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Les Combettes Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru 2018
Description: Aromas of pear, yellow orchard fruit, fresh pastry and orange oil introduce the 2018 Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru Les Combettes (Domaine Louis Jadot), a medium to full-bodied, round and enveloping wine that's among the richer, more powerful premiers crus in the range this year. Textural and multidimensional, it will offer a broad drinking window. Score - 91-93. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Domaine Louis Jadot Domaine des Héritiers Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru 2018
Description: A full, very dense white that is tightly structured and layered. Plenty of cooked apples, lemons and white pineapple with stone and mineral undertones. Compact and tight. Solid and powerful. Give it three to four years to open, but already fantastic. Better after 2023. Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, Aug. 24, 2020)

title: Maison Louis Jadot Bâtard-Montrachet Grand Cru 2018
Description: A cuvée derived from three different sources?one in grapes, two in must?all located on the Puligny side of this large grand cru, the 2018 Bâtard-Montrachet Grand Cru (Maison Louis Jadot) opens in the glass with aromas of orange oil, honeycomb, buttered orchard fruit and freshly baked bread. On the palate, it's full-bodied, deep and muscular, rich and multidimensional, with lively underpinning acidity despite its rounded, fleshy profile. Score - 93-95. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Maison Louis Jadot Saint-Romain 2018
Description: The 2018 Saint-Romain (Maison Louis Jadot) is a pretty young wine, bursting from the glass with notes of citrus zest, honeysuckle and fresh pastry. On the palate, it's medium to full-bodied, tensile and precise, with a mouthwateringly mineral finish. Drink date: 2019-2029. Score - 89. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, Jan. 9, 2020)

title: Pannon Tokaj 5 Puttonyos Tokaji Aszú 2014
Description: This wine is sourced from volcanic soils and fermented in stainless steel before being aged in barrel for two years and a further one year in bottle. This creates a wine with a fresh, elegant character and complex honeyed spice and fruit.[Monde Selection Bruxelles did not include a tasting note.] Score - Grand Gold. (Monde Selection Bruxelles, 2019)

title: Château Caillou Private Cuvée 1997
Description: This wine is sourced from old vines grown in clay-limestone soils. It will reflect the refined quality and ageability that has set Sauternes apart in the world of fine sweet wines. Unctuous and textured with richly defined honey, tropical fruit, and precise acidity. A remarkable opportunity to experience mature Sauternes.

title: Mulderbosch Single Vineyard Series Block A Chenin Blanc 2018
Description: Made every year since 2013, Mulderbosch's single vineyard Chenins are a fascinating way to compare soil types. This comes from gravel, clay and decomposed granite and is pale, floral and sappy, with bracing, mineral-edged acidity and notes of baking spices and beeswax. 2020-28. Score - 94. (timatkin.com, South Africa Special Report 2019)

title: Moscato D'Asti DOCG Centive 2019
Description: This is Moscato as it should be, made by a small, family-owned and operated winery in the heart of Piemonte's Asti region. Delicate, delicious and refreshing, it shows intense aromas of yellow apple, tropical fruit and honey. The palate is a perfect balance between the rich, sweet fruit, bright, racy acids, and creamy bubbles. This is a seriously elegant wine that will delight before or after dinner.

title: Gavi Del Comune Di Gavi DOCG 2019
Description: The Bertolino family wine style leans toward ripeness and concentration, and this Gavi is no exception. Made from hand-harvested Cortese, skin contact and fermentation are longer than most in the category. Moderate lees contact lends texture and weight while maintaining the grape's natural fresh character and acidity. Loaded with bright, intense citrus, yellow plum and white pepper with a salty, long finish.

title: Nicolay Bouzeron Aligote 2018
Description: The appellation goes hand and hand with the Aligoté grape and here it finds a beautiful expression. The colour is light straw. The nose is honeyed and rich with aromas of acacia and spring flowers and salty oysters. On the palate there is generous fruit, flinty mineral notes with nice energy and floral qualities. In the finish, the salinity comes back to give the wine a refreshing end note.

title: Mirus Trajadura 2019
Description: Trajadura is one of the key grape varieties found in Portugal's fresh Vinho Verde wines. Mirus Trajadura is a fresh wine with delicious lemon acidity as well as a tang of orange zest. Its bright character is enhanced by the sliced apple crispness that goes right through this wine.

title: Mirus Arinto 2019
Description: Arinto is the grape here, more rich and ripe than expected, with a crisp, citrus minerality from the granite soil with a creamy mouthfeel.

title: Galan Chardonnay2016
Description: This wine stands out by its elegance and complexness. It brings out the advantages of the region and reveals its unique character of its hand selected grapes due to the gentle production process and handling. Both bouquet and taste are distinguished by delicate fruity notes. Enjoy this wine as accompaniment to meat, fish or pasta.

title: Domaine Agnes et Didier Dauvissat Petit Chablis 2018
Description: Nice pale yellow colour with lightly green hints. Flattering nose with rich aromas of ripe fruit, citrus fruits and pineapple. Soft attack sustained by a pleasant finality. 94 points - Rosemary George/Decanter

title: Shabo Chardonnay 2019
Description: A wine of light-straw colour that has vivid peach and apricot flavour with citrus notes and a fresh, round, lasting taste with fruit tones.

title: Château Purcari Traminer de Purcari Stefan Voda 2019
Description: Distinctive aroma of late roses followed by a long, velvety aftertaste. Well-balanced, aromatic and fresh wine.

title: Deu La Deu Alvarinho 2019
Description: Made from selected vineyards of high quality Alvarinho grapes. Aromas of lemon zest, passion fruit and peaches. Palate is dry and refreshing with ample acidity and some mineral notes on the long elegant finish a great pairing for grilled seafood.

title: Adega Moncao Alvarinho 2019
Description: Made from 100% Alvarinho grapes, aromas of tropical fruits with citrus, dry and medium body with mineral notes and a long elegant finish.

title: Esk Valley Winemakers Reserve Chenin Blanc 2019
Description: A rich and full-bodied style of Chenin Blanc. It showcases the yellow fruit nature of Chenin blanc with notes of pineapple, quince, and honey evident. The wine is complex, a small amount of residual sugar provides richness in a Vouvray demi-sec style. Delicious as a young wine will also gain further complexity with time in bottle.

title: Esk Valley Winemakers Reserve Chardonnay 2018
Description: This elegant, complex, and creamy textured Chardonnay which vividly displays the complexity of this vineyard site. Flavours of white peach, grapefruit, flint and nuts are to the fore with a long mineral finish. Naturally made, with a hands-off approach, it is both food friendly and age-worthy. It vividly exhibits the land in which it was grown. Further complexity has been added with subtle oak and yeast derived complexity from long term barrel aging.

title: Adega Moncao White 2019
Description: Made from Alvarinho and Trajadura grapes this wine has aromas of citrus and peach. It is dry and has some fizz while remaining fresh and bright. A great patio sipper.

title: Matevosyan Xarji White Dry Wine 2017
Description: Made from Areni grapes, this natural dry white wine has pleasant acerbity and grape aromas.

title: Clos des Lunes Lune d'Argent 2017
Description: Pretty exotic fruit with grapefruit and lemon character. Medium body, bright acidity and a delicious finish. Score - 92-93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: Château Puygueraud Blanc 2017
Description: This is really fun and energetic with sliced apples, limes and lemons as well as some minerals. Energetic green papaya. Medium body, vivid acidity and a crisp and bright finish. Delicious. Drink and enjoy. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com)

title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte Blanc 2017
Description: A blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc with 5% Sauvignon Gris and 5% Sémillon, the Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Blanc offers up gorgeous, super-intense scents of pink grapefruit, white peaches, kumquats and ginger with wafts of under-ripe pineapple, lime blossoms and crushed rocks. Medium-bodied, it's very polished, sophisticated and wonderfully electric in the mouth, with sparks of citrus fruits, tropical notions and floral perfume exploding on the palate, finishing with epic persistence. Score - 96-98+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com)

title: Sokol Blosser Dundee Hills Estate Chardonnay 2017
Description: Very attractive baked pears and peaches with baking spices that add early complexity. The palate has a smooth build of fresh, fleshy, ripe pears and peaches and delivers an attractively long, mouth-filling style. Drink now. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, July 2, 2019)

title: Quinta D'Amares Loureiro Alvarinho 2019
Description: Citrus, with lemon nuances. Young varietal aroma, fruity with floral notes. Harmonious, balanced acidity and minerality.

title: Alamos Chardonnay 2014
Description: The 2014 Alamos Chardonnay mixes fruit from Agrelo and the Uco Valley that fermented in a mixture of stainless-steel and cement tanks. Part of the wine is matured in oak barrels for six months while the rest is kept in stainless steel and cement, then blended and bottled. The nose is ripe with yellow fruit, nicely spiced and has lactic hints. The medium-bodied palate is accessible and easy to drink ... Ideal for white meats and light foods, as the winemaking is very subtle and does not dominate at all. Drink: 2015-2017.  Score - 88. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Aug. 2015)

title: Thatched Hut Sauvignon Blanc 2012
Description: Intensely aromatic with tons of herbal/grassy notes and a great whack of pineapple, melon and fresh asparagus on the nose. Ripe and round with awesome bright fruit flavours. The finish is tangy and long.   (Vintages panel, Aug. 2013)

title: Kardanakhi Khikhvi Qvevri PDO 2017
Description: This dry amber wine is light golden in colour with deep aromas of mature fruits, dried citrus fruits and concentrated grape juice.

title: Tsarapi Qvevri Rkatsiteli 2016
Description: Very complex aroma of yellow fruits, rose petals and toasted almonds. First taste is soft and rich in mineral. Complex flavours with dried apricots, pears, sweet spices, light vanilla and coconut notes. Long and silky finish with soft and mature tannins.

title: Albert Bichot Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Chablis 1er Cru 2017
Description: Quite a generous style of Chablis with ripe-pear character. But, with some time and air, this also reveals some earthy depths and the long, mineral finish shows great promise for the future. Better from 2020. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 12, 2019)

title: Royal Tokaji 5 Puttonyos Tokaji Aszú 2013
Description: Straw colored with gold reflections, this delightful sweet wine has aromas of dried pear, fresh apricot and yellow peach. Flavors of fresh Bartlett pear, acacia honey and tinned apricots unfold on the palate. The finish is sweet, with just the right amount of acidity. Editors' Choice. Score - 96. (Jeff Jenssen, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2017)

title: Vinatigo Listan Blanco 2019
Description: Listán Blanco de Canarias is cultivated on the beautiful island of Tenerife in the Canary Islands. The vines are trained in 'parrales', a training method inherited by the Portuguese who established themselves on the island back in the 15th century. These vertical structures help vines manoeuver on the difficult topography created by the eruptions of active volcano, Teide. This wine is sustainably farmed on 100 year old vines. Due to the influence of the Trade Winds, this wine is very fresh and has a vibrant acidity. On the nose, it has fragrant aromas of fennel, dried fruits and fig tree leaves.

title: Boekenhoutskloof Semillon 2010
Description: Gorgeous, offering clementine, tangerine and singed Brazil nut notes allied to a creamy frame. The long finish lets orange blossom, white ginger and warm brioche hints fill in. Should develop breadth and length in the cellar. Best from 2014 through 2019. Score - 92. (James Molesworth, Wine Spectator Insider, March 20, 2012)

title: Domaine du Haut Bourg Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu 2018
Description: 100% Melon de Bourgogne. Floral, citrus and apple nose. The palate is packed with stone fruit flavours and kept fresh with lemony acidity and a persistent, salty-nutty finish. Delicious and very classic. Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2019)

title: Thornbury Pinot Gris 2020
Description: The wine displays lovely delicate floral Pinot Gris characters of fresh citrus, white pear and hints of lychee and spice. The palate is textured and mouth-filling finishing with excellent freshness. Best enjoyed young.

title: Richter Graacher Himmelreich Riesling Kabinett 2019
Description: 'The 2019 Graacher Himmelreich Riesling Kabinett was fermented down to fruity-styled levels of residual sugar (50 g/l). It offers a gorgeous nose made of elderflower, yellow peach, pear, grapefruit, and floral elements. The wine is gorgeously intense and yet superbly playful on the palate, where succulent fresh fruits mingle with more mineral elements. A touch of creaminess comes through in the finish, which admirably complements the juicy but racy kick of acidity. Some almond paste and apricot come through in the aftertaste add a Spätlese touch to the wine without taking anything away from its juiciness. This fruity-styled wine is a true winner. (2020-2029)'. (MFW, June 2020)

title: By Farr GC Côte Vineyard Chardonnay 2018
Description: Light, bright yellow colour with a creamy, sur-lie bouquet which incorporates lemon juice and lemon pith, subtle touches of toasted nuts, and many other subtleties. The taste is fresh and bright with elevated acidity and a crisp, clean finish. Good persistence. This has room to grow and would benefit from another year in the bottle. An outstanding wine. Drink date: 2020-2030. Ranked #1 of 25 of The Real Review's 2018 Chardonnay from Geelong.  Score - 97. (Huon Hooke, therealreview.com, Feb. 20, 2020)

title: Rippon Mature Vine Riesling 2019
Description: Lighter and livelier than the 2018 (a warmer vintage, which weighed in a full percent higher in finished alcohol by volume), Rippon's 2019 Mature Vine Riesling strikes a winning balance between fresh green apple, tangy citrus and spring-like florals. It's medium-bodied (12% alcohol) and almost dry, with great concentration and length. Classically built, it should age well for over a decade. Drink date: 2020-2035. Score - 94+. (Joe Czerwinski, robertparker.com, March 31, 2020)

title: Domaine du Roc des Boutires En Bertilionne Pouilly-Fuissé 2018
Description: The 2018 Pouilly-Fuissé En Bertilionne mingles notes of orange oil and yellow apple with hints of beeswax and fresh pastry. Medium to full-bodied, satiny and enveloping, it's a textural, elegantly muscular wine girdled by bright acids, concluding with a penetrating finish. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 92. (William Kelley, robertparker.com, April 30, 2020)

title: Quinta Da Laceira White 2019
Description: Fresh on the nose, with citrus and white fruit notes. Average concentration in the mouth, but very fresh, fruity, with some mineral and a long finish.

title: Schloss Johannisberg Gelblack Riesling Trocken 2019
Description: Although this belongs in the estate-riesling category, it has a certain nobility, thanks to the exact combination of substance, polish and aromatic finesse. Lots of mirabelle, but also hints of red apple, fresh pineapple and honeysuckle. Long finish that's generous and super clean. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, Sept. 16, 2020)

title: Domaine du Chardonnay Montmains Chablis 1er Cru 2011
Description: If you're going to call yourself Domaine du Chardonnay, you had better deliver, and this classically styled Chablis certainly hits all the marks. This will suggest aromas and flavours of ripe green apple and smoky minerality and will offer the elegance and marked steely acidity that makes Chablis such an excellent match for seafood and fish in creamy sauces. A great value.

title: Martin Ray Chardonnay 2016
Description: Has the full, creamy mouthfeel one expects in a California Chard, but in this version it's appealingly balanced by a tangy, citrus freshness. (Nick Passmore, forbes.com, April 22, 2017)

title: Radacini Vintage Chardonnay 2018
Description: Barrel fermented Chardonnay is elegant and richly textured, bursting with flavours of white peach, apricot and citrus. A balanced acidity, bright fruit flavours and a creamy mouth feel fills the palate, creating a lovely finish.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé Collection Pinot Gris 2014
Description: Pale lemon in the glass, but anything but pale on the nose or on the palate. Expressive tropical fruit and spice with peach, apples and melon. Bright and crisp and ideal for pork tenderloin. (Vintages panel, April 2015)

title: Barton & Guestier Les Petites Parcelles Vouvray Chenin Blanc
Schloss Schönborn Hattenheimer Pfaffenberg Riesling Kabinett 2010
Description: Young and fruity-tasting, with apple and pear flavors that feature good cut and vibrancy. The crisp finish features plenty of fresh acidity. Drink now through 2020.  Score - 88. (Kim Marcus, winespectator.com, Web Only, 2012)

title: De Palmela Vale dos Barris Moscatel 2019
Description: Citrus yellow, an intense floral aroma with a few notes of orange blossom and rose petals, a fresh and well structured palate. Serve with grilled fish dishes, oven roasts or seafood.

title: Kuria White Transdanubian PGI 2019
Description: Playful blend, aromas of white flowers, lemon and white flesh peach on the nose. The palate is driven by the trio of apple, pear and peach, complemented by the impressions of tropical fruit and a hint of white pepper.

title: Chanzy Les Reuchaux Puligny-Montrachet 2014
Description: Puligny-Montrachet produces some Pinot Noir, but this is Chardonnay country through and through. The white wines here are famously aromatic and complex, and approach the quality of those from Montrachet, the most celebrated of Burgundy's Grand Cru and considered to be the source of the greatest examples of Chardonnay in the world. The 2014 Chanzy Puligny-Montrachet Les Reuchaux will be complex, with a pure mineral undertone and the region's distinct nutty aromas.

title: Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc 2014
Description: Very flinty tank sample 14 starts out green - grass, hay, limes - before tropical notes, yellow citrus & balancing acidity take over. Needs & deserves some time to settle, should improve. Score - 4 out of 5 stars. (Cathy Marston, Platter's South African Wine Guide, 2015)

title: Saintsbury Chardonnay 2012
Description: Lemony and balanced in oak, it reveals ripe Asian pear, creamy vanilla and a swirl of toffee. Medium bodied and smooth on the palate, it features buoyant acidity. It's ideal for pairing with roast chicken or meat topped with an apple chutney. Score - 90. (Virginie Boone, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 2014)

title: Frog's Leap Sauvignon Blanc 2016
Description: Dry farmed and organically grown in Frog's Leap's estate vineyards in Rutherford, this Sauvignon Blanc showcases the sunshine of Napa Valley with the verve and freshness for which the varietal is prized. Look for notions of tropical fruit, herbs and delicate minerality.

title: Kindzmarauli Kisi Qvevri 2018
Description: Harmonious aroma of ripe and dried yellow fruits with shades of peach, mango, nectarine and honey. Full-bodied with rounded texture it has a pleasant taste with notes of peach, green tea, bay leaf and rose petals.

title: Tbilvino White Sachino Kakheti 2019
Description: Crafted from indigenous Rkatsiteli grapes grown in Kakheti region, this off-dry white boasts rich aromas of sweet sun-dried-raisined grapes and walnut. The wine is mild and pleasant. Serve chilled with Asian cuisine, buttered fish dishes, fruit salads, and medium-sweet deserts like apple pie or Kiwi tart.

title: Di Meo F Fiano di Avellino 2019
Description: Acacia flower, yellow peach, pear and citrus aromas mingle together. Tangy and linear, the palate offers apricot, honey, hazelnut and a lemon drop candy note alongside fresh acidity.  Score - 91. (Kerin O'Keefe, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2020)

title: Albert Sounit Les Coères Montagny 1er Cru 2017
Description: Montagny produces only Chardonnays, which are notably aromatic and offer a range of floral tones. The wines can suggest notes of mayflower, honeysuckle, acacia, bramble flowers and even bracken alongside ripe pear and peach. Some wines also reflect a hint of flinty minerality, but all Montagny's wines are fresh, structured and refined. This one comes from a producer founded in 1850.

title: François d'Allaines Tête de Cuvée Meursault
Domaine Roland Lavantureux Vau de Vey Chablis 1er Cru
Maison des Hâtes Les Beauregards Chablis 1er Cru
Domaine Germain Monthélie Blanc 2019
Description: This wine is sourced from vines planted in 1990 and 2000 in clay and limestone soils. The grapes are hand-harvested and the wine is aged for up to 10 months in oak before bottling. Monthélie Chardonnay is similar in style to Meursault and offers apple, lemon and nut tones, with a zesty acidity and gorgeous texture.

title: Thibert Père & Fils Les Cras Pouilly-Fuissé 2015
Description: (a blend of three small vineyards; bottled in June): Pale yellow. Inviting, higher-pitched aromas of soft citrus fruits, crushed rock and spices. Broad and rich but vibrant too, conveying terrific energy and smoky, spicy, savory intensity to its flavors of menthol and crushed stone. Wonderfully fine-grained Pouilly-Fuissé with sneaky length--and a lemony elegance and grip that are atypical for this vintage. Time in the cellar should bring greater richness without any loss of spine. Drinking window: 2019-2025. Score - 92. (Stephen Tanzer, vinous.com, Nov. 2017)

title: Brittan Vineyards Chardonnay 2017
Description: Stunningly rich, yet perfectly balanced, this is a superb bottle in every respect. Pinpoint ripeness leads to lush and spicy fruit flavors of apple, pear and banana. There's a pleasing yeasty/bready note, along with lovely barrel toast (23% was new). The wine is smooth from start to finish, and just as good on days two and three, suggesting that it will cellar nicely. But why wait - it's quite possibly going to be your favorite Chardonnay of the year. Editors' Choice. Score - 95. (Paul Gregutt, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2020)

title: Pascal Bouchard Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Chablis 1er Cru 2015
Description: This vineyard on the left, cooler bank of the River Serein brings out great minerality in its wines even in warm vintages such as this. Full of ripe yellow fruits, textured and still young, the wine has a toasty character from wood aging. Drink this rich wine from 2021. Editors' Choice. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2018)

title: Domaine Berthelemot Abbaye de Morgeot Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru 2018
Description: Roger Voss of Wine Enthusiast awarded the 2017 vintage of this wine a rating of 94 points on October 1, 2019, stating that it showed '... structure and a zesty, mineral texture ... as well as wonderful fruitiness ...' The 2018 version will reflect similar quality, as well as revealing the great tension and freshness that is a defining characteristic of Burgundy's 2018 Chardonnays.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset Le Limozin Meursault 2018
Description: Le Limozin is named for a stream that once flowed past the vineyard. The site has earned a respectable reputation, which isn't surprising, as Le Limozin is nestled between the premier-cru vineyards Les Genevrières and Les Charmes. The vines of Le Limozin are over 45 years of age, and the wines produced here reflect much of the balance, richness, depth and complexity of its famous neighbours.

title: Leitz Rüdesheimer Drachenstein Erste Lage Riesling Trocken 2018
Description: This Erste-Lage ('premier cru') site on loess clay containing sandstone and quartzite is located at the top of the Rüdesheim, adjacent to a forest which encourages large diurnal temperature swings. Consequently, even during a long, hot summer such as 2018, this wine retains a glacial freshness and amazing balance. It has a lovely texture and good depth of flavour, with notes of apple, lime and even some apple skin. Creamy, woody hints fill out the wine on the mid-palate. This should be even more delicious in a few years. Tank sample. Drinking window: 2020-2033. Score - 93. (James Button, decanter.com, May 6, 2019)

title: Domaine Bachelet-Monnot Chassagne-Montrachet 2018
Description: A ripe if restrained nose shyly reflects notes of resin, pear, apple and an admirably discreet dollop of wood. There is fine volume and surprisingly good power to the vibrant and mouth coating medium-bodied flavors that possess fine depth and persistence. This is an excellent Chassagne villages and worth considering. Drink: 2025+. Outstanding. Top value. Score - 89-92. (Allen Meadows, burghound.com, June 10, 2020)

title: Dr. H. Thanisch Graacher Himmelreich GG Riesling 2018
Description: Perfumed with hints of grapefruit pith, smoky flint, peach and apricot, while the palate is graced with spice, saffron and a lifted, fine acidity.  Score - 95. (Decanter World Wine Awards, 2020)
By:: Weingut Wwe. Dr. H. Thanisch. Erben

title: Domaine Thibert Père et Fils Les Ménétrières Pouilly-Fuissé
Fattoria La Rivolta Greco Taburno Sannio 2019
Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this has a deep golden hue and enticing aromas of exotic fruit, spring blossom and wild herb. On the delicious palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe apricot, yellow apple and peach alongside vibrant acidity. Score - 93. (Kerin O'Keefe, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 1, 2020)

title: Bachelet-Ramonet Chassagne-Montrachet 2018
Description: The Chardonnay wines produced in the Chassagne-Montrachet region are consistently among the finest and most complex dry white wines in the world. This one comes from the remarkable 2018 vintage and carries the region's benchmark balance, elegance, minerality and toasty notes. Pair it with lobster or crab.

title: Silvio Carta Badde Alva Vermentino di Sardegna 2009
Description: Attractive yellow-straw colour with aromas of caramel apple, pear, baked earth, dried herbs and spice. Dry, fairly robust and fruity with fine, zippy acids and an herb-accented finish. Poised, crisp and very nicely made. Enjoy it with grilled herbed chicken, or shrimp with pasta and pesto. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2011)

title: Dr. Von Bassermann-Jordan Riesling Kabinett 2007
Description: Fresh tree fruits and grapefruit, it's just off-dry with a rich texture, loads of minerally flavours and a smooth, clean finish. (Daenna Van Mulligen, winescores.ca, July 31, 2008)

title: Selbach-Oster Zeltinger Himmelreich Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken
Domaine de l'Idylle Anne de Chypre Roussette de Savoie
William Fèvre Little Quino Sauvignon Blanc
William Hill North Coast Sauvignon Blanc
Left Coast The Orchard Pinot Gris
Le Tertre du Lys d'Or Cuvée d'Exception Sauternes
Gary Farrell Russian River Selection Chardonnay
Cantine di Dolianova Prendas Vermentino di Sardegna
Paul Jaboulet Aîné Ventoux Les Traverses
Luna Sauvignon Blanc
By:: Zn Agri Ltd Ta Luna Estate

title: Cellier des Dauphins Les Dauphins Cuvée Spéciale Côtes du Rhône
Meyer Family Vineyards Stevens Block Chardonnay
Litorale Val delle Rose Vermentino 2019
Description: Cooked apples and pears with some lemon undertones. It's medium-bodied with creamy texture and a long, flavorful finish. Drink now. Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, July 14, 2020)

title: Domaine de Montille Puligny-Montrachet 2017
Description: Very bright and pure aromas of white peaches and lemons with a subtle, stony edge to the nose, too. The palate has a very succulent and juicy feel. Exceptional purity and concentration of flavor with very nicely wound acidity threading the long and on-point finish. Drink in the next six to eight years. Score - 92-93. (jamessuckling.com, Feb. 12, 2019)

title: Domaine de Montille Bourgogne Blanc 2017
Description: From a site purchased by Étienne de Montille in 2012, this wine was aged in older 600 L barrels. A concentrated, tasty wine, with a lifted floral note atop lemon and orange citrus. It also shows an exotic touch of spice.

title: Maison de Montille Saint-Romain 2017
Description: Maison Deux Montille is the négociant arm of Domaine de Montille and is a pun playing on the original involvement of Etienne de Montille and his sister, Alix. This wine is sourced mostly from the Les Jarrons premier cru and sees more lees stirring than the domaine's whites. Racy, creamy and lightly wooded, with welcome minerality. Drinking window: 2019-2025. Score - 91. (Tim Atkin, MW, decanter.com, Oct. 22, 2018)

title: 2018 Schiopetto Blanc des Rosis IGT
Description: Dried spices, such as cloves. Together with melon, apples and hints of citrus. Medium to full body. Very spicy and intense with a long, long finish. An excellent blend of 50% friulano, 20% pinot grigio, 20% pinot bianco and 10% sauvignon. 94 points James Suckling

title: Les Parcellaires de Saulx Puligny-Montrachet 1er Cru Champ Canet 2017
By:: Sas Le Manoir Des Grands Bourg

title: Laurent Ponsot Cuvée du Perce Neige Bourgogne
Laurent Ponsot Cuvée du Pandorea Meursault
Laurent Ponsot Cuvée de la Centaurée Les Charmes Meursault 1er Cru
Laurent Ponsot Cuvée du Kalimeris Corton Charlemagne Grand Cru
Domaine Comte Georges de Vogüé Musigny Blanc 2015
Flat Rock The Rusty Shed Chardonnay 2018
Description: Golden colour; spicy, toasty, apple, developing barnyard notes; medium-bodied, dry, richly extracted, peach and caramel flavours carried on balancing acidity - well-integrated oak, lovely mouth-feel. Score - 92. (Tony Aspler, tonyaspler.com, A Wine Lover's Diary, Nov. 3, 2019)

title: Susana Balbo Crios Torrontés
Description: Susana Balbo has been called the 'Evita of Wine' and the 'Queen of Torrontés.' Her Crios Torrontés is floral and fruity with apple blossom, peach, orange citrus and lime. Argentina's signature grape will work with smoked meats or seafood.

title: 20 Bees Chardonnay VQA
Description: Medium yellow; aromas & flavours of green apple, citrus & pear; dry, unoaked with a lively finish.Bees are hardworking, unselfish and in tune with their environment - all qualities that would also describe Ontario winegrowers! Enjoy yellow pear, smoky oak and grapefruit flavours with nutty and spicy notes leading to a clean finish. Serve with seafood, salads or poultry.

title: Babich Black Label Sauvignon Blanc 2018
Description: A pure expression of intense, ripe tropical fruit in the mango and peach zone. The palate has a lot of fleshy, flavorsome tropical fruit and nicely captured freshness. [Ready to] Drink now. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 8, 2018)

title: Astrolabe Sauvignon Blanc 2019
Description: Ripe, deliciously fruity sauvignon blanc with melon, guava and citrus-lime, together with [a] smattering of fresh herbs. A creamy-textured wine with good weight and a lingering finish. Textbook Marlborough sauvignon. Drink 2019-2023. Score - 94. (bobcampbell.nz, Dec. 6, 2019)

title: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Chardonnay
Description: Founder Wolfgang Blass has been making wine in South Australia since 1966. This chardonnay is aged with French oak to create a balanced and generous flavour profile. Enjoy aromas and flavours of savory nuttiness and citrus, with hints of minerality and fresh mushrooms. Serve with seafood, veal tenderloin or pumpkin ravioli.

title: Terres Secrètes Les Préludes Saint-Véran 2018
Description: The Saint-Véran AC offers exceptional value for Burgundy lovers. This lesser-known region adjacent to Pouilly-Fuissé has much in common with its famous neighbour, but its wines check in at a much more approachable price. This one will be lithe and lifted, with citrus and stone fruit and a fine mineral undertone. Try it with grilled shrimp.[Guide Gilbert & Gaillard did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Guide Gilbert & Gaillard, 2019)

title: Strandveld First Sighting Sauvignon Blanc 2020
Description: A superb value, this Bordeaux-style blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon is crafted to reflect a zesty, ripe character that shows off impressive tropical fruit, citrus and herbs, with a refined minerality. From South Africa's southernmost reaches, it shows lift and freshness that reflect the influence of both the Atlantic and Indian oceans, so it's no surprise it's so good with seafood.

title: G.A. Schmitt Winzertanz
Description: One of the leading German wine brands in our market, delivering good value and consistently clean, crisp, fruit-driven wines. Off-dry, with aromas and flavours of herbs, fresh bread, yellow berries and citrus. Serve well-chilled with spicy fare, Thai spring rolls, schnitzel or smoked kasseler pork chops.

title: Domaines Schlumberger Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris 2018
Description: Hints of ripe, yellow pear just peek through on the shy nose of this wine. The palate sweeps in with the ripe juiciness of yellow pear, adding lovely phenolic pithiness that provides texture and direction. Subtle freshness highlights the beautifully dry and concentrated finish. Score - 89. (Anne Krebiehl, MW, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 1, 2020)

title: Santa Rita 120 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc
Description: The 120 Reserva range commemorates the 120th anniversary of Viña Santa Rita. Hand-harvested, and fermented at cool temperatures. Light, lively and refreshing on the palate, with flavours of gooseberry, herbs, chamomile, lemon and passion fruit. Serve with salads, grilled fish or vegetable soups.
